summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom the word of the Lord came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then said I:
“Ah, Lord God!
Behold, I cannot speak, for I am a youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord said to me:
“Do not say, ‘I am a youth,’
For you shall go to all to whom I send you,
And whatever I command you, you shall speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid of their faces,
For I am with you to deliver you,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord put forth His hand and touched my mouth, and the Lord said to me:
“Behold, I have put My words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, I have this day set you over the nations and over the kingdoms,
To root out and to pull down,
To destroy and to throw down,
To build and to plant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Jeremiah, what do you see?”
And I said, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “You have seen well, for I am ready to perform My word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the word of the Lord came to me the second time, saying, “What do you see?”
And I said, “I see a boiling pot, and it is facing away from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to me:
“Out of the north calamity shall break forth
On all the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, I am calling
All the families of the kingdoms of the north,” says the Lord;
“They shall come and each one set his throne
At the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem,
Against all its walls all around,
And against all the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will utter My judgments
Against them concerning all their wickedness,
Because they have forsaken Me,
Burned incense to other gods,
And worshiped the works of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore prepare yourself and arise,
And speak to them all that I command you.
Do not be dismayed before their faces,
Lest I dismay you before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, I have made you this day
A fortified city and an iron pillar,
And bronze walls against the whole land—
Against the kings of Judah,
Against its princes,
Against its priests,
And against the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will fight against you,
But they shall not prevail against you.
For I am with you,” says the Lord, “to deliver you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go and cry in the hearing of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord:
“I remember you,
The kindness of your youth,
The love of your betrothal,
When you went after Me in the wilderness,
In a land not sown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel was holiness to the Lord,
The firstfruits of His increase.
All that devour him will offend;
Disaster will come upon them,” says the Lord.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word of the Lord, O house of Jacob and all the families of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“What injustice have your fathers found in Me,
That they have gone far from Me,
Have followed idols,
And have become idolaters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Neither did they say, ‘Where is the Lord,
Who brought us up out of the land of Egypt,
Who led us through the wilderness,
Through a land of deserts and pits,
Through a land of drought and the shadow of death,
Through a land that no one crossed
And where no one dwelt?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I brought you into a bountiful country,
To eat its fruit and its goodness.
But when you entered, you defiled My land
And made My heritage an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I will yet bring charges against you,” says the Lord,
“And against your children’s children I will bring charges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For pass beyond the coasts of Cyprus and see,
Send to Kedar and consider diligently,
And see if there has been such a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has a nation changed its gods,
Which are not gods?
But My people have changed their Glory
For what does not profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“For My people have committed two evils:
They have forsaken Me, the fountain of living waters,
And hewn themselves cisterns—broken cisterns that can hold no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is Israel a servant?
Is he a homeborn slave?
Why is he plundered?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Also the people of Noph and Tahpanhes
Have broken the crown of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not brought this on yourself,
In that you have forsaken the Lord your God
When He led you in the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now why take the road to Egypt,
To drink the waters of Sihor?
Or why take the road to Assyria,
To drink the waters of the River?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your own wickedness will correct you,
And your backslidings will rebuke you.
Know therefore and see that it is an evil and bitter thing
That you have forsaken the Lord your God,
And the fear of Me is not in you,”
Says the Lord God of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For of old I have broken your yoke and burst your bonds;
And you said, ‘I will not transgress,’
When on every high hill and under every green tree
You lay down, playing the harlot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I had planted you a noble vine, a seed of highest quality.
How then have you turned before Me
Into the degenerate plant of an alien vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For though you wash yourself with lye, and use much soap,
Yet your iniquity is marked before Me,” says the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘I am not polluted,
I have not gone after the Baals’?
See your way in the valley;
Know what you have done:
You are a swift dromedary breaking loose in her ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Withhold your foot from being unshod, and your throat from thirst.
But you said, ‘There is no hope.
No! For I have loved aliens, and after them I will go.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Saying to a tree, ‘You are my father,’
And to a stone, ‘You gave birth to me.’
For they have turned their back to Me, and not their face.
But in the time of their trouble
They will say, ‘Arise and save us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But where are your gods that you have made for yourselves?
Let them arise,
If they can save you in the time of your trouble;
For according to the number of your cities
Are your gods, O Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why will you plead with Me?
You all have transgressed against Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In vain I have chastened your children;
They received no correction.
Your sword has devoured your prophets
Like a destroying lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O generation, see the word of the Lord!
Have I been a wilderness to Israel,
Or a land of darkness?
Why do My people say, ‘We are lords;
We will come no more to You’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a virgin forget her ornaments,
Or a bride her attire?
Yet My people have forgotten Me days without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why do you beautify your way to seek love?
Therefore you have also taught
The wicked women your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also on your skirts is found
The blood of the lives of the poor innocents.
I have not found it by secret search,
But plainly on all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you say, ‘Because I am innocent,
Surely His anger shall turn from me.’
Behold, I will plead My case against you,
Because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you gad about so much to change your way?
Also you shall be ashamed of Egypt as you were ashamed of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed you will go forth from him
With your hands on your head;
For the Lord has rejected your trusted allies,
And you will not prosper by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They say, ‘If a man divorces his wife,
And she goes from him
And becomes another man’s,
May he return to her again?’
Would not that land be greatly polluted?
But you have played the harlot with many lovers;
Yet return to Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Lift up your eyes to the desolate heights and see:
Where have you not lain with men?
By the road you have sat for them
Like an Arabian in the wilderness;
And you have polluted the land
With your harlotries and your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the showers have been withheld,
And there has been no latter rain.
You have had a harlot’s forehead;
You refuse to be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you not from this time cry to Me,
‘My Father, You are the guide of my youth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will He remain angry forever?
Will He keep it to the end?’
Behold, you have spoken and done evil things,
As you were able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: “Have you seen what backsliding Israel has done? She has gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and there played the harlot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, after she had done all these things, ‘Return to Me.’ But she did not return. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw that for all the causes for which backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a certificate of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah did not fear, but went and played the harlot also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came to pass, through her casual harlotry, that she defiled the land and committed adultery with stones and trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah has not turned to Me with her whole heart, but in pretense,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Backsliding Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Only acknowledge your iniquity,
That you have transgressed against the Lord your God,
And have scattered your charms
To alien deities under every green tree,
And you have not obeyed My voice,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return, O backsliding children,” says the Lord; “for I am married to you. I will take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give you shepherds according to My heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then it shall come to pass, when you are multiplied and increased in the land in those days,” says the Lord, “that they will say no more, ‘The ark of the covenant of the Lord.’ It shall not come to mind, nor shall they remember it, nor shall they visit it, nor shall it be made anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time Jerusalem shall be called The Throne of the Lord, and all the nations shall be gathered to it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem. No more shall they follow the dictates of their evil hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given as an inheritance to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I said:
‘How can I put you among the children
And give you a pleasant land,
A beautiful heritage of the hosts of nations?’
“And I said:
‘You shall call Me, “My Father,”
And not turn away from Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely, as a wife treacherously departs from her husband,
So have you dealt treacherously with Me,
O house of Israel,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice was heard on the desolate heights,
Weeping and supplications of the children of Israel.
For they have perverted their way;
They have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Return, you backsliding children,
And I will heal your backslidings.” 
“Indeed we do come to You,
For You are the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly, in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills,
And from the multitude of mountains;
Truly, in the Lord our God
Is the salvation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For shame has devoured
The labor of our fathers from our youth—
Their flocks and their herds,
Their sons and their daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We lie down in our shame,
And our reproach covers us.
For we have sinned against the Lord our God,
We and our fathers,
From our youth even to this day,
And have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you will return, O Israel,” says the Lord,
“Return to Me;
And if you will put away your abominations out of My sight,
Then you shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you shall swear, ‘The Lord lives,’
In truth, in judgment, and in righteousness;
The nations shall bless themselves in Him,
And in Him they shall glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord to the men of Judah and Jerusalem:
“Break up your fallow ground,
And do not sow among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Circumcise yourselves to the Lord,
And take away the foreskins of your hearts,
You men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem,
Lest My fury come forth like fire,
And burn so that no one can quench it,
Because of the evil of your doings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say:
“Blow the trumpet in the land;
Cry, ‘Gather together,’
And say, ‘Assemble yourselves,
And let us go into the fortified cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set up the standard toward Zion.
Take refuge! Do not delay!
For I will bring disaster from the north,
And great destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lion has come up from his thicket,
And the destroyer of nations is on his way.
He has gone forth from his place
To make your land desolate.
Your cities will be laid waste,
Without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this, clothe yourself with sackcloth,
Lament and wail.
For the fierce anger of the Lord
Has not turned back from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord,
“That the heart of the king shall perish,
And the heart of the princes;
The priests shall be astonished,
And the prophets shall wonder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Ah, Lord God!
Surely You have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem,
Saying, ‘You shall have peace,’
Whereas the sword reaches to the heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time it will be said
To this people and to Jerusalem,
“A dry wind of the desolate heights blows in the wilderness
Toward the daughter of My people—
Not to fan or to cleanse—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wind too strong for these will come for Me;
Now I will also speak judgment against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, he shall come up like clouds,
And his chariots like a whirlwind.
His horses are swifter than eagles.
Woe to us, for we are plundered!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness,
That you may be saved.
How long shall your evil thoughts lodge within you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a voice declares from Dan
And proclaims affliction from Mount Ephraim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Make mention to the nations,
Yes, proclaim against Jerusalem,
That watchers come from a far country
And raise their voice against the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like keepers of a field they are against her all around,
Because she has been rebellious against Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your ways and your doings
Have procured these things for you.
This is your wickedness,
Because it is bitter,
Because it reaches to your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my soul, my soul!
I am pained in my very heart!
My heart makes a noise in me;
I cannot hold my peace,
Because you have heard, O my soul,
The sound of the trumpet,
The alarm of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destruction upon destruction is cried,
For the whole land is plundered.
Suddenly my tents are plundered,
And my curtains in a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will I see the standard,
And hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For My people are foolish,
They have not known Me.
They are silly children,
And they have no understanding.
They are wise to do evil,
But to do good they have no knowledge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beheld the earth, and indeed it was without form, and void;
And the heavens, they had no light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beheld the mountains, and indeed they trembled,
And all the hills moved back and forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beheld, and indeed there was no man,
And all the birds of the heavens had fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I beheld, and indeed the fruitful land was a wilderness,
And all its cities were broken down
At the presence of the Lord,
By His fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For this shall the earth mourn,
And the heavens above be black,
Because I have spoken.
I have purposed and will not relent,
Nor will I turn back from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whole city shall flee from the noise of the horsemen and bowmen.
They shall go into thickets and climb up on the rocks.
Every city shall be forsaken,
And not a man shall dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And when you are plundered,
What will you do?
Though you clothe yourself with crimson,
Though you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold,
Though you enlarge your eyes with paint,
In vain you will make yourself fair;
Your lovers will despise you;
They will seek your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For I have heard a voice as of a woman in labor,
The anguish as of her who brings forth her first child,
The voice of the daughter of Zion bewailing herself;
She spreads her hands, saying,
‘Woe is me now, for my soul is weary
Because of murderers!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Run to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem;
See now and know;
And seek in her open places
If you can find a man,
If there is anyone who executes judgment,
Who seeks the truth,
And I will pardon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they say, ‘As the Lord lives,’
Surely they swear falsely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, are not Your eyes on the truth?
You have stricken them,
But they have not grieved;
You have consumed them,
But they have refused to receive correction.
They have made their faces harder than rock;
They have refused to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I said, “Surely these are poor.
They are foolish;
For they do not know the way of the Lord,
The judgment of their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will go to the great men and speak to them,
For they have known the way of the Lord,
The judgment of their God.” 
But these have altogether broken the yoke
And burst the bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“How shall I pardon you for this?
Your children have forsaken Me
And sworn by those that are not gods.
When I had fed them to the full,
Then they committed adultery
And assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were like well-fed lusty stallions;
Every one neighed after his neighbor’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?” says the Lord.
“And shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up on her walls and destroy,
But do not make a complete end.
Take away her branches,
For they are not the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah
Have dealt very treacherously with Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have lied about the Lord,
And said, “It is not He.
Neither will evil come upon us,
Nor shall we see sword or famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the prophets become wind,
For the word is not in them.
Thus shall it be done to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord God of hosts:
“Because you speak this word,
Behold, I will make My words in your mouth fire,
And this people wood,
And it shall devour them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will bring a nation against you from afar,
O house of Israel,” says the Lord.
“It is a mighty nation,
It is an ancient nation,
A nation whose language you do not know,
Nor can you understand what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their quiver is like an open tomb;
They are all mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “Nevertheless in those days,” says the Lord, “I will not make a complete end of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be when you say, ‘Why does the Lord our God do all these things to us?’ then you shall answer them, ‘Just as you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so you shall serve aliens in a land that is not yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare this in the house of Jacob
And proclaim it in Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Hear this now, O foolish people,
Without understanding,
Who have eyes and see not,
And who have ears and hear not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you not fear Me?’ says the Lord.
‘Will you not tremble at My presence,
Who have placed the sand as the bound of the sea,
By a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass beyond it?
And though its waves toss to and fro,
Yet they cannot prevail;
Though they roar, yet they cannot pass over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But this people has a defiant and rebellious heart;
They have revolted and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not say in their heart,
“Let us now fear the Lord our God,
Who gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season.
He reserves for us the appointed weeks of the harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your iniquities have turned these things away,
And your sins have withheld good from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As a cage is full of birds,
So their houses are full of deceit.
Therefore they have become great and grown rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?’ says the Lord.
‘Shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“An astonishing and horrible thing
Has been committed in the land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophets prophesy falsely,
And the priests rule by their own power;
And My people love to have it so.
But what will you do in the end?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O you children of Benjamin,
Gather yourselves to flee from the midst of Jerusalem!
Blow the trumpet in Tekoa,
And set up a signal-fire in Beth Haccerem;
For disaster appears out of the north,
And great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have likened the daughter of Zion
To a lovely and delicate woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds with their flocks shall come to her.
They shall pitch their tents against her all around.
Each one shall pasture in his own place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Prepare war against her;
Arise, and let us go up at noon.
Woe to us, for the day goes away,
For the shadows of the evening are lengthening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, and let us go by night,
And let us destroy her palaces.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus has the Lord of hosts said:
“Cut down trees,
And build a mound against Jerusalem.
This is the city to be punished.
She is full of oppression in her midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a fountain wells up with water,
So she wells up with her wickedness.
Violence and plundering are heard in her.
Before Me continually are grief and wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be instructed, O Jerusalem,
Lest My soul depart from you;
Lest I make you desolate,
A land not inhabited.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
To whom shall I speak and give warning,
That they may hear?
Indeed their ear is uncircumcised,
And they cannot give heed.
Behold, the word of the Lord is a reproach to them;
They have no delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I am full of the fury of the Lord.
I am weary of holding it in.
“I will pour it out on the children outside,
And on the assembly of young men together;
For even the husband shall be taken with the wife,
The aged with him who is full of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And their houses shall be turned over to others,
Fields and wives together;
For I will stretch out My hand
Against the inhabitants of the land,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because from the least of them even to the greatest of them,
Everyone is given to covetousness;
And from the prophet even to the priest,
Everyone deals falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have also healed the hurt of My people slightly,
Saying, ‘Peace, peace!’
When there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Stand in the ways and see,
And ask for the old paths, where the good way is,
And walk in it;
Then you will find rest for your souls.
But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, I set watchmen over you, saying,
‘Listen to the sound of the trumpet!’
But they said, ‘We will not listen.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear, you nations,
And know, O congregation, what is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O earth!
Behold, I will certainly bring calamity on this people—
The fruit of their thoughts,
Because they have not heeded My words
Nor My law, but rejected it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what purpose to Me
Comes frankincense from Sheba,
And sweet cane from a far country?
Your burnt offerings are not acceptable,
Nor your sacrifices sweet to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
“Behold, I will lay stumbling blocks before this people,
And the fathers and the sons together shall fall on them.
The neighbor and his friend shall perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Behold, a people comes from the north country,
And a great nation will be raised from the farthest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard the report of it;
Our hands grow feeble.
Anguish has taken hold of us,
Pain as of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not go out into the field,
Nor walk by the way.
Because of the sword of the enemy,
Fear is on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O daughter of my people,
Dress in sackcloth
And roll about in ashes!
Make mourning as for an only son, most bitter lamentation;
For the plunderer will suddenly come upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have set you as an assayer and a fortress among My people,
That you may know and test their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The bellows blow fiercely,
The lead is consumed by the fire;
The smelter refines in vain,
For the wicked are not drawn off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People will call them rejected silver,
Because the Lord has rejected them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stand in the gate of the Lord’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, all you of Judah who enter in at these gates to worship the Lord!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not trust in these lying words, saying, ‘The temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord are these.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For if you thoroughly amend your ways and your doings, if you thoroughly execute judgment between a man and his neighbor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you do not oppress the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place, or walk after other gods to your hurt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, you trust in lying words that cannot profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and walk after other gods whom you do not know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then come and stand before Me in this house which is called by My name, and say, ‘We are delivered to do all these abominations’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this house, which is called by My name, become a den of thieves in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But go now to My place which was in Shiloh, where I set My name at the first, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, because you have done all these works,” says the Lord, “and I spoke to you, rising up early and speaking, but you did not hear, and I called you, but you did not answer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I will do to the house which is called by My name, in which you trust, and to this place which I gave to you and your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will cast you out of My sight, as I have cast out all your brethren—the whole posterity of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore do not pray for this people, nor lift up a cry or prayer for them, nor make intercession to Me; for I will not hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood, the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead dough, to make cakes for the queen of heaven; and they pour out drink offerings to other gods, that they may provoke Me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do they provoke Me to anger?” says the Lord. “Do they not provoke themselves, to the shame of their own faces?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: “Behold, My anger and My fury will be poured out on this place—on man and on beast, on the trees of the field and on the fruit of the ground. And it will burn and not be quenched.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and eat meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I did not speak to your fathers, or command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is what I commanded them, saying, ‘Obey My voice, and I will be your God, and you shall be My people. And walk in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but followed the counsels and the dictates of their evil hearts, and went backward and not forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I have even sent to you all My servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not obey Me or incline their ear, but stiffened their neck. They did worse than their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore you shall speak all these words to them, but they will not obey you. You shall also call to them, but they will not answer you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you shall say to them, ‘This is a nation that does not obey the voice of the Lord their God nor receive correction. Truth has perished and has been cut off from their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cut off your hair and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on the desolate heights; for the Lord has rejected and forsaken the generation of His wrath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Judah have done evil in My sight,” says the Lord. “They have set their abominations in the house which is called by My name, to pollute it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire, which I did not command, nor did it come into My heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when it will no more be called Tophet, or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter; for they will bury in Tophet until there is no room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The corpses of this people will be food for the birds of the heaven and for the beasts of the earth. And no one will frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will cause to cease from the cities of Judah and from the streets of Jerusalem the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride. For the land shall be desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” says the Lord, “they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of its princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall spread them before the sun and the moon and all the host of heaven, which they have loved and which they have served and after which they have walked, which they have sought and which they have worshiped. They shall not be gathered nor buried; they shall be like refuse on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of those who remain of this evil family, who remain in all the places where I have driven them,” says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moreover you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord:
“Will they fall and not rise?
Will one turn away and not return?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why has this people slidden back,
Jerusalem, in a perpetual backsliding?
They hold fast to deceit,
They refuse to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I listened and heard,
But they do not speak aright.
No man repented of his wickedness,
Saying, ‘What have I done?’
Everyone turned to his own course,
As the horse rushes into the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Even the stork in the heavens
Knows her appointed times;
And the turtledove, the swift, and the swallow
Observe the time of their coming.
But My people do not know the judgment of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘We are wise,
And the law of the Lord is with us’?
Look, the false pen of the scribe certainly works falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise men are ashamed,
They are dismayed and taken.
Behold, they have rejected the word of the Lord;
So what wisdom do they have?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of My people slightly,
Saying, ‘Peace, peace!’
When there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination?
No! They were not at all ashamed,
Nor did they know how to blush.
Therefore they shall fall among those who fall;
In the time of their punishment
They shall be cast down,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will surely consume them,” says the Lord.
“No grapes shall be on the vine,
Nor figs on the fig tree,
And the leaf shall fade;
And the things I have given them shall pass away from them.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why do we sit still?
Assemble yourselves,
And let us enter the fortified cities,
And let us be silent there.
For the Lord our God has put us to silence
And given us water of gall to drink,
Because we have sinned against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We looked for peace, but no good came;
And for a time of health, and there was trouble!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The snorting of His horses was heard from Dan.
The whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of His strong ones;
For they have come and devoured the land and all that is in it,
The city and those who dwell in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For behold, I will send serpents among you,
Vipers which cannot be charmed,
And they shall bite you,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would comfort myself in sorrow;
My heart is faint in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! The voice,
The cry of the daughter of my people
From a far country:
“Is not the Lord in Zion?
Is not her King in her?” 
“Why have they provoked Me to anger
With their carved images—
With foreign idols?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The harvest is past,
The summer is ended,
And we are not saved!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no balm in Gilead,
Is there no physician there?
Why then is there no recovery
For the health of the daughter of my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that my head were waters,
And my eyes a fountain of tears,
That I might weep day and night
For the slain of the daughter of my people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that I had in the wilderness
A lodging place for travelers;
That I might leave my people,
And go from them!
For they are all adulterers,
An assembly of treacherous men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And like their bow they have bent their tongues for lies.
They are not valiant for the truth on the earth.
For they proceed from evil to evil,
And they do not know Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Everyone take heed to his neighbor,
And do not trust any brother;
For every brother will utterly supplant,
And every neighbor will walk with slanderers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your dwelling place is in the midst of deceit;
Through deceit they refuse to know Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?” says the Lord.
“Shall I not avenge Myself on such a nation as this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take up a weeping and wailing for the mountains,
And for the dwelling places of the wilderness a lamentation,
Because they are burned up,
So that no one can pass through;
Nor can men hear the voice of the cattle.
Both the birds of the heavens and the beasts have fled;
They are gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a den of jackals.
I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the wise man who may understand this? And who is he to whom the mouth of the Lord has spoken, that he may declare it? Why does the land perish and burn up like a wilderness, so that no one can pass through?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not obeyed My voice, nor walked according to it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they have walked according to the dictates of their own hearts and after the Baals, which their fathers taught them,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will feed them, this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter them also among the Gentiles, whom neither they nor their fathers have known. And I will send a sword after them until I have consumed them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
“Consider and call for the mourning women,
That they may come;
And send for skillful wailing women,
That they may come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them make haste
And take up a wailing for us,
That our eyes may run with tears,
And our eyelids gush with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a voice of wailing is heard from Zion:
‘How we are plundered!
We are greatly ashamed,
Because we have forsaken the land,
Because we have been cast out of our dwellings.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet hear the word of the Lord, O women,
And let your ear receive the word of His mouth;
Teach your daughters wailing,
And everyone her neighbor a lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For death has come through our windows,
Has entered our palaces,
To kill off the children—no longer to be outside!
And the young men—no longer on the streets!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak, “Thus says the Lord:
‘Even the carcasses of men shall fall as refuse on the open field,
Like cuttings after the harvester,
And no one shall gather them.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom,
Let not the mighty man glory in his might,
Nor let the rich man glory in his riches;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let him who glories glory in this,
That he understands and knows Me,
That I am the Lord, exercising lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness in the earth.
For in these I delight,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “that I will punish all who are circumcised with the uncircumcised—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt, Judah, Edom, the people of Ammon, Moab, and all who are in the farthest corners, who dwell in the wilderness. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word which the Lord speaks to you, O house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Do not learn the way of the Gentiles;
Do not be dismayed at the signs of heaven,
For the Gentiles are dismayed at them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are upright, like a palm tree,
And they cannot speak;
They must be carried,
Because they cannot go by themselves.
Do not be afraid of them,
For they cannot do evil,
Nor can they do any good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Inasmuch as there is none like You, O Lord
(You are great, and Your name is great in might),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who would not fear You, O King of the nations?
For this is Your rightful due.
For among all the wise men of the nations,
And in all their kingdoms,
There is none like You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they are altogether dull-hearted and foolish;
A wooden idol is a worthless doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is the true God;
He is the living God and the everlasting King.
At His wrath the earth will tremble,
And the nations will not be able to endure His indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall say to them: “The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth shall perish from the earth and from under these heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has made the earth by His power,
He has established the world by His wisdom,
And has stretched out the heavens at His discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He utters His voice,
There is a multitude of waters in the heavens:
“And He causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
He brings the wind out of His treasuries.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are futile, a work of errors;
In the time of their punishment they shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Portion of Jacob is not like them,
For He is the Maker of all things,
And Israel is the tribe of His inheritance;
The Lord of hosts is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather up your wares from the land,
O inhabitant of the fortress!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“Behold, I will throw out at this time
The inhabitants of the land,
And will distress them,
That they may find it so.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me for my hurt!
My wound is severe.
But I say, “Truly this is an infirmity,
And I must bear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tent is plundered,
And all my cords are broken;
My children have gone from me,
And they are no more.
There is no one to pitch my tent anymore,
Or set up my curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the shepherds have become dull-hearted,
And have not sought the Lord;
Therefore they shall not prosper,
And all their flocks shall be scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the noise of the report has come,
And a great commotion out of the north country,
To make the cities of Judah desolate, a den of jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, I know the way of man is not in himself;
It is not in man who walks to direct his own steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, correct me, but with justice;
Not in Your anger, lest You bring me to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out Your fury on the Gentiles, who do not know You,
And on the families who do not call on Your name;
For they have eaten up Jacob,
Devoured him and consumed him,
And made his dwelling place desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear the words of this covenant, and speak to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel: “Cursed is the man who does not obey the words of this covenant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I commanded your fathers in the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, ‘Obey My voice, and do according to all that I command you; so shall you be My people, and I will be your God,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may establish the oath which I have sworn to your fathers, to give them ‘a land flowing with milk and honey,’ as it is this day.” ’ ”
And I answered and said, “So be it, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying: ‘Hear the words of this covenant and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I earnestly exhorted your fathers in the day I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, until this day, rising early and exhorting, saying, “Obey My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but everyone followed the dictates of his evil heart; therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but which they have not done.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “A conspiracy has been found among the men of Judah and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers who refused to hear My words, and they have gone after other gods to serve them; the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken My covenant which I made with their fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will surely bring calamity on them which they will not be able to escape; and though they cry out to Me, I will not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they offer incense, but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For according to the number of your cities were your gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem you have set up altars to that shameful thing, altars to burn incense to Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So do not pray for this people, or lift up a cry or prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry out to Me because of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What has My beloved to do in My house,
Having done lewd deeds with many?
And the holy flesh has passed from you.
When you do evil, then you rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord called your name,
Green Olive Tree, Lovely and of Good Fruit.
With the noise of a great tumult
He has kindled fire on it,
And its branches are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord of hosts, who planted you, has pronounced doom against you for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke Me to anger in offering incense to Baal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord gave me knowledge of it, and I know it; for You showed me their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I was like a docile lamb brought to the slaughter; and I did not know that they had devised schemes against me, saying, “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be remembered no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But, O Lord of hosts,
You who judge righteously,
Testing the mind and the heart,
Let me see Your vengeance on them,
For to You I have revealed my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the men of Anathoth who seek your life, saying, ‘Do not prophesy in the name of the Lord, lest you die by our hand’—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord of hosts: ‘Behold, I will punish them. The young men shall die by the sword, their sons and their daughters shall die by famine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there shall be no remnant of them, for I will bring catastrophe on the men of Anathoth, even the year of their punishment.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous are You, O Lord, when I plead with You;
Yet let me talk with You about Your judgments.
Why does the way of the wicked prosper?
Why are those happy who deal so treacherously?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have planted them, yes, they have taken root;
They grow, yes, they bear fruit.
You are near in their mouth
But far from their mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But You, O Lord, know me;
You have seen me,
And You have tested my heart toward You.
Pull them out like sheep for the slaughter,
And prepare them for the day of slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the land mourn,
And the herbs of every field wither?
The beasts and birds are consumed,
For the wickedness of those who dwell there,
Because they said, “He will not see our final end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you have run with the footmen, and they have wearied you,
Then how can you contend with horses?
And if in the land of peace,
In which you trusted, they wearied you,
Then how will you do in the floodplain of the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For even your brothers, the house of your father,
Even they have dealt treacherously with you;
Yes, they have called a multitude after you.
Do not believe them,
Even though they speak smooth words to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have forsaken My house, I have left My heritage;
I have given the dearly beloved of My soul into the hand of her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My heritage is to Me like a speckled vulture;
The vultures all around are against her.
Come, assemble all the beasts of the field,
Bring them to devour!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The plunderers have come
On all the desolate heights in the wilderness,
For the sword of the Lord shall devour
From one end of the land to the other end of the land;
No flesh shall have peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have sown wheat but reaped thorns;
They have put themselves to pain but do not profit.
But be ashamed of your harvest
Because of the fierce anger of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Against all My evil neighbors who touch the inheritance which I have caused My people Israel to inherit—behold, I will pluck them out of their land and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it shall be, after I have plucked them out, that I will return and have compassion on them and bring them back, everyone to his heritage and everyone to his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, if they will learn carefully the ways of My people, to swear by My name, ‘As the Lord lives,’ as they taught My people to swear by Baal, then they shall be established in the midst of My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they do not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Lord said to me: “Go and get yourself a linen sash, and put it around your waist, but do not put it in water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I got a sash according to the word of the Lord, and put it around my waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me the second time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the sash that you acquired, which is around your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a hole in the rock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the Lord commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass after many days that the Lord said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take from there the sash which I commanded you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went to the Euphrates and dug, and I took the sash from the place where I had hidden it; and there was the sash, ruined. It was profitable for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘In this manner I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This evil people, who refuse to hear My words, who follow the dictates of their hearts, and walk after other gods to serve them and worship them, shall be just like this sash which is profitable for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the sash clings to the waist of a man, so I have caused the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah to cling to Me,’ says the Lord, ‘that they may become My people, for renown, for praise, and for glory; but they would not hear.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore you shall speak to them this word: ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel: “Every bottle shall be filled with wine.” ’
“And they will say to you, ‘Do we not certainly know that every bottle will be filled with wine?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land—even the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem—with drunkenness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together,” says the Lord. “I will not pity nor spare nor have mercy, but will destroy them.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear and give ear:
Do not be proud,
For the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give glory to the Lord your God
Before He causes darkness,
And before your feet stumble
On the dark mountains,
And while you are looking for light,
He turns it into the shadow of death
And makes it dense darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if you will not hear it,
My soul will weep in secret for your pride;
My eyes will weep bitterly
And run down with tears,
Because the Lord’s flock has been taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and to the queen mother,
“Humble yourselves;
Sit down,
For your rule shall collapse, the crown of your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your eyes and see
Those who come from the north.
Where is the flock that was given to you,
Your beautiful sheep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you say when He punishes you?
For you have taught them
To be chieftains, to be head over you.
Will not pangs seize you,
Like a woman in labor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if you say in your heart,
“Why have these things come upon me?”
For the greatness of your iniquity
Your skirts have been uncovered,
Your heels made bare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard its spots?
Then may you also do good who are accustomed to do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I will scatter them like stubble
That passes away by the wind of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is your lot,
The portion of your measures from Me,” says the Lord,
“Because you have forgotten Me
And trusted in falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will uncover your skirts over your face,
That your shame may appear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen your adulteries
And your lustful neighings,
The lewdness of your harlotry,
Your abominations on the hills in the fields.
Woe to you, O Jerusalem!
Will you still not be made clean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Judah mourns,
And her gates languish;
They mourn for the land,
And the cry of Jerusalem has gone up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because the ground is parched,
For there was no rain in the land,
The plowmen were ashamed;
They covered their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the deer also gave birth in the field,
But left because there was no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, though our iniquities testify against us,
Do it for Your name’s sake;
For our backslidings are many,
We have sinned against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O the Hope of Israel, his Savior in time of trouble,
Why should You be like a stranger in the land,
And like a traveler who turns aside to tarry for a night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should You be like a man astonished,
Like a mighty one who cannot save?
Yet You, O Lord, are in our midst,
And we are called by Your name;
Do not leave us!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Do not pray for this people, for their good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. But I will consume them by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God! Behold, the prophets say to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, nor shall you have famine, but I will give you assured peace in this place.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “The prophets prophesy lies in My name. I have not sent them, commanded them, nor spoken to them; they prophesy to you a false vision, divination, a worthless thing, and the deceit of their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name, whom I did not send, and who say, ‘Sword and famine shall not be in this land’—‘By sword and famine those prophets shall be consumed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; they will have no one to bury them—them nor their wives, their sons nor their daughters—for I will pour their wickedness on them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore you shall say this word to them:
‘Let my eyes flow with tears night and day,
And let them not cease;
For the virgin daughter of my people
Has been broken with a mighty stroke, with a very severe blow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I go out to the field,
Then behold, those slain with the sword!
And if I enter the city,
Then behold, those sick from famine!
Yes, both prophet and priest go about in a land they do not know.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have You utterly rejected Judah?
Has Your soul loathed Zion?
Why have You stricken us so that there is no healing for us?
We looked for peace, but there was no good;
And for the time of healing, and there was trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We acknowledge, O Lord, our wickedness
And the iniquity of our fathers,
For we have sinned against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Are there any among the idols of the nations that can cause rain?
Or can the heavens give showers?
Are You not He, O Lord our God?
Therefore we will wait for You,
Since You have made all these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel stood before Me, My mind would not be favorable toward this people. Cast them out of My sight, and let them go forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “And I will appoint over them four forms of destruction,” says the Lord: “the sword to slay, the dogs to drag, the birds of the heavens and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hand them over to trouble, to all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for what he did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem?
Or who will bemoan you?
Or who will turn aside to ask how you are doing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have forsaken Me,” says the Lord,
“You have gone backward.
Therefore I will stretch out My hand against you and destroy you;
I am weary of relenting!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me, my mother,
That you have borne me,
A man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth!
I have neither lent for interest,
Nor have men lent to me for interest.
Every one of them curses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said:
“Surely it will be well with your remnant;
Surely I will cause the enemy to intercede with you
In the time of adversity and in the time of affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone break iron,
The northern iron and the bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wealth and your treasures
I will give as plunder without price,
Because of all your sins,
Throughout your territories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will make you cross over with your enemies
Into a land which you do not know;
For a fire is kindled in My anger,
Which shall burn upon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, You know;
Remember me and visit me,
And take vengeance for me on my persecutors.
In Your enduring patience, do not take me away.
Know that for Your sake I have suffered rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your words were found, and I ate them,
And Your word was to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart;
For I am called by Your name,
O Lord God of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not sit in the assembly of the mockers,
Nor did I rejoice;
I sat alone because of Your hand,
For You have filled me with indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is my pain perpetual
And my wound incurable,
Which refuses to be healed?
Will You surely be to me like an unreliable stream,
As waters that fail?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
“If you return,
Then I will bring you back;
You shall stand before Me;
If you take out the precious from the vile,
You shall be as My mouth.
Let them return to you,
But you must not return to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked,
And I will redeem you from the grip of the terrible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord also came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take a wife, nor shall you have sons or daughters in this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord concerning the sons and daughters who are born in this place, and concerning their mothers who bore them and their fathers who begot them in this land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall die gruesome deaths; they shall not be lamented nor shall they be buried, but they shall be like refuse on the face of the earth. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, and their corpses shall be meat for the birds of heaven and for the beasts of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: “Do not enter the house of mourning, nor go to lament or bemoan them; for I have taken away My peace from this people,” says the Lord, “lovingkindness and mercies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both the great and the small shall die in this land. They shall not be buried; neither shall men lament for them, cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor shall men break bread in mourning for them, to comfort them for the dead; nor shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or their mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will cause to cease from this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it shall be, when you show this people all these words, and they say to you, ‘Why has the Lord pronounced all this great disaster against us? Or what is our iniquity? Or what is our sin that we have committed against the Lord our God?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say to them, ‘Because your fathers have forsaken Me,’ says the Lord; ‘they have walked after other gods and have served them and worshiped them, and have forsaken Me and not kept My law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you have done worse than your fathers, for behold, each one follows the dictates of his own evil heart, so that no one listens to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will cast you out of this land into a land that you do not know, neither you nor your fathers; and there you shall serve other gods day and night, where I will not show you favor.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “that it shall no more be said, ‘The Lord lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, ‘The Lord lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north and from all the lands where He had driven them.’ For I will bring them back into their land which I gave to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I will send for many fishermen,” says the Lord, “and they shall fish them; and afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain and every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My eyes are on all their ways; they are not hidden from My face, nor is their iniquity hidden from My eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And first I will repay double for their iniquity and their sin, because they have defiled My land; they have filled My inheritance with the carcasses of their detestable and abominable idols.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, my strength and my fortress,
My refuge in the day of affliction,
The Gentiles shall come to You
From the ends of the earth and say,
“Surely our fathers have inherited lies,
Worthlessness and unprofitable things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will a man make gods for himself,
Which are not gods?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore behold, I will this once cause them to know,
I will cause them to know
My hand and My might;
And they shall know that My name is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron;
With the point of a diamond it is engraved
On the tablet of their heart,
And on the horns of your altars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While their children remember
Their altars and their wooden images
By the green trees on the high hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O My mountain in the field,
I will give as plunder your wealth, all your treasures,
And your high places of sin within all your borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Cursed is the man who trusts in man
And makes flesh his strength,
Whose heart departs from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he shall be like a shrub in the desert,
And shall not see when good comes,
But shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness,
In a salt land which is not inhabited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord,
And whose hope is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he shall be like a tree planted by the waters,
Which spreads out its roots by the river,
And will not fear when heat comes;
But its leaf will be green,
And will not be anxious in the year of drought,
Nor will cease from yielding fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I, the Lord, search the heart,
I test the mind,
Even to give every man according to his ways,
According to the fruit of his doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As a partridge that broods but does not hatch,
So is he who gets riches, but not by right;
It will leave him in the midst of his days,
And at his end he will be a fool.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A glorious high throne from the beginning
Is the place of our sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, the hope of Israel,
All who forsake You shall be ashamed. 
“Those who depart from Me
Shall be written in the earth,
Because they have forsaken the Lord,
The fountain of living waters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed they say to me,
“Where is the word of the Lord?
Let it come now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be a terror to me;
You are my hope in the day of doom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be ashamed who persecute me,
But do not let me be put to shame;
Let them be dismayed,
But do not let me be dismayed.
Bring on them the day of doom,
And destroy them with double destruction!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Lord said to me: “Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, by which the kings of Judah come in and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, who enter by these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the Sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day, nor do any work, but hallow the Sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not obey nor incline their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear nor receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it shall be, if you heed Me carefully,” says the Lord, “to bring no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but hallow the Sabbath day, to do no work in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then shall enter the gates of this city kings and princes sitting on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their princes, accompanied by the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall remain forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall come from the cities of Judah and from the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin and from the lowland, from the mountains and from the South, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and incense, bringing sacrifices of praise to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you will not heed Me to hallow the Sabbath day, such as not carrying a burden when entering the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause you to hear My words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and there he was, making something at the wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the vessel that he made of clay was marred in the hand of the potter; so he made it again into another vessel, as it seemed good to the potter to make.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O house of Israel, can I not do with you as this potter?” says the Lord. “Look, as the clay is in the potter’s hand, so are you in My hand, O house of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The instant I speak concerning a nation and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up, to pull down, and to destroy it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if that nation against whom I have spoken turns from its evil, I will relent of the disaster that I thought to bring upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the instant I speak concerning a nation and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if it does evil in My sight so that it does not obey My voice, then I will relent concerning the good with which I said I would benefit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I am fashioning a disaster and devising a plan against you. Return now every one from his evil way, and make your ways and your doings good.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “That is hopeless! So we will walk according to our own plans, and we will every one obey the dictates of his evil heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
“Ask now among the Gentiles,
Who has heard such things?
The virgin of Israel has done a very horrible thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will a man leave the snow water of Lebanon,
Which comes from the rock of the field?
Will the cold flowing waters be forsaken for strange waters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because My people have forgotten Me,
They have burned incense to worthless idols.
And they have caused themselves to stumble in their ways,
From the ancient paths,
To walk in pathways and not on a highway,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Come and let us devise plans against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come and let us attack him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give heed to me, O Lord,
And listen to the voice of those who contend with me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall evil be repaid for good?
For they have dug a pit for my life.
Remember that I stood before You
To speak good for them,
To turn away Your wrath from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore deliver up their children to the famine,
And pour out their blood
By the force of the sword;
Let their wives become widows
And bereaved of their children.
Let their men be put to death,
Their young men be slain
By the sword in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a cry be heard from their houses,
When You bring a troop suddenly upon them;
For they have dug a pit to take me,
And hidden snares for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet, Lord, You know all their counsel
Which is against me, to slay me.
Provide no atonement for their iniquity,
Nor blot out their sin from Your sight;
But let them be overthrown before You.
Deal thus with them
In the time of Your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Go and get a potter’s earthen flask, and take some of the elders of the people and some of the elders of the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator
