verses.text: And go out to the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the Potsherd Gate; and proclaim there the words that I will tell you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will bring such a catastrophe on this place, that whoever hears of it, his ears will tingle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because they have forsaken Me and made this an alien place, because they have burned incense in it to other gods whom neither they, their fathers, nor the kings of Judah have known, and have filled this place with the blood of the innocents
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (they have also built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings to Baal, which I did not command or speak, nor did it come into My mind),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “that this place shall no more be called Tophet or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place, and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies and by the hands of those who seek their lives; their corpses I will give as meat for the birds of the heaven and for the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make this city desolate and a hissing; everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss because of all its plagues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and everyone shall eat the flesh of his friend in the siege and in the desperation with which their enemies and those who seek their lives shall drive them to despair.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall break the flask in the sight of the men who go with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “Even so I will break this people and this city, as one breaks a potter’s vessel, which cannot be made whole again; and they shall bury them in Tophet till there is no place to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I will do to this place,” says the Lord, “and to its inhabitants, and make this city like Tophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be defiled like the place of Tophet, because of all the houses on whose roofs they have burned incense to all the host of heaven, and poured out drink offerings to other gods.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah came from Tophet, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of the Lord’s house and said to all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will bring on this city and on all her towns all the doom that I have pronounced against it, because they have stiffened their necks that they might not hear My words.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Pashhur the son of Immer, the priest who was also chief governor in the house of the Lord, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened on the next day that Pashhur brought Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord has not called your name Pashhur, but Magor-Missabib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes shall see it. I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive to Babylon and slay them with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I will deliver all the wealth of this city, all its produce, and all its precious things; all the treasures of the kings of Judah I will give into the hand of their enemies, who will plunder them, seize them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house, shall go into captivity. You shall go to Babylon, and there you shall die, and be buried there, you and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied lies.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For when I spoke, I cried out;
I shouted, “Violence and plunder!”
Because the word of the Lord was made to me
A reproach and a derision daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “I will not make mention of Him,
Nor speak anymore in His name.”
But His word was in my heart like a burning fire
Shut up in my bones;
I was weary of holding it back,
And I could not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I heard many mocking:
“Fear on every side!”
“Report,” they say, “and we will report it!”
All my acquaintances watched for my stumbling, saying,
“Perhaps he can be induced;
Then we will prevail against him,
And we will take our revenge on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is with me as a mighty, awesome One.
Therefore my persecutors will stumble, and will not prevail.
They will be greatly ashamed, for they will not prosper.
Their everlasting confusion will never be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But, O Lord of hosts,
You who test the righteous,
And see the mind and heart,
Let me see Your vengeance on them;
For I have pleaded my cause before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord! Praise the Lord!
For He has delivered the life of the poor
From the hand of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the day in which I was born!
Let the day not be blessed in which my mother bore me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the man be cursed
Who brought news to my father, saying,
“A male child has been born to you!”
Making him very glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And let that man be like the cities
Which the Lord overthrew, and did not relent;
Let him hear the cry in the morning
And the shouting at noon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he did not kill me from the womb,
That my mother might have been my grave,
And her womb always enlarged with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I come forth from the womb to see labor and sorrow,
That my days should be consumed with shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Melchiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please inquire of the Lord for us, for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon makes war against us. Perhaps the Lord will deal with us according to all His wonderful works, that the king may go away from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to them, “Thus you shall say to Zedekiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel: “Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, with which you fight against the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who besiege you outside the walls; and I will assemble them in the midst of this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I Myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger and fury and great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast; they shall die of a great pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward,” says the Lord, “I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, his servants and the people, and such as are left in this city from the pestilence and the sword and the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life; and he shall strike them with the edge of the sword. He shall not spare them, or have pity or mercy.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you shall say to this people, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but he who goes out and defects to the Chaldeans who besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be as a prize to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have set My face against this city for adversity and not for good,” says the Lord. “It shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And concerning the house of the king of Judah, say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of David! Thus says the Lord:
“Execute judgment in the morning;
And deliver him who is plundered
Out of the hand of the oppressor,
Lest My fury go forth like fire
And burn so that no one can quench it,
Because of the evil of your doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley,
And rock of the plain,” says the Lord,
“Who say, ‘Who shall come down against us?
Or who shall enter our dwellings?’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and there speak this word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, you who sit on the throne of David, you and your servants and your people who enter these gates!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Execute judgment and righteousness, and deliver the plundered out of the hand of the oppressor. Do no wrong and do no violence to the stranger, the fatherless, or the widow, nor shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you indeed do this thing, then shall enter the gates of this house, riding on horses and in chariots, accompanied by servants and people, kings who sit on the throne of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not hear these words, I swear by Myself,” says the Lord, “that this house shall become a desolation.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord to the house of the king of Judah:
“You are Gilead to Me,
The head of Lebanon;
Yet I surely will make you a wilderness,
Cities which are not inhabited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will prepare destroyers against you,
Everyone with his weapons;
They shall cut down your choice cedars
And cast them into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many nations will pass by this city; and everyone will say to his neighbor, ‘Why has the Lord done so to this great city?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will answer, ‘Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God, and worshiped other gods and served them.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Weep not for the dead, nor bemoan him;
Weep bitterly for him who goes away,
For he shall return no more,
Nor see his native country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord concerning Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, who went from this place: “He shall not return here anymore,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he shall die in the place where they have led him captive, and shall see this land no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness
And his chambers by injustice,
Who uses his neighbor’s service without wages
And gives him nothing for his work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who says, ‘I will build myself a wide house with spacious chambers,
And cut out windows for it,
Paneling it with cedar
And painting it with vermilion.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shall you reign because you enclose yourself in cedar?
Did not your father eat and drink,
And do justice and righteousness?
Then it was well with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet your eyes and your heart are for nothing but your covetousness,
For shedding innocent blood,
And practicing oppression and violence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
“They shall not lament for him,
Saying, ‘Alas, my brother!’ or ‘Alas, my sister!’
They shall not lament for him,
Saying, ‘Alas, master!’ or ‘Alas, his glory!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall be buried with the burial of a donkey,
Dragged and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up to Lebanon, and cry out,
And lift up your voice in Bashan;
Cry from Abarim,
For all your lovers are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I spoke to you in your prosperity,
But you said, ‘I will not hear.’
This has been your manner from your youth,
That you did not obey My voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind shall eat up all your rulers,
And your lovers shall go into captivity;
Surely then you will be ashamed and humiliated
For all your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O inhabitant of Lebanon,
Making your nest in the cedars,
How gracious will you be when pangs come upon you,
Like the pain of a woman in labor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” says the Lord, “though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were the signet on My right hand, yet I would pluck you off;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will give you into the hand of those who seek your life, and into the hand of those whose face you fear—the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will cast you out, and your mother who bore you, into another country where you were not born; and there you shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the land to which they desire to return, there they shall not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is this man Coniah a despised, broken idol—
A vessel in which is no pleasure?
Why are they cast out, he and his descendants,
And cast into a land which they do not know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O earth, earth, earth,
Hear the word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
‘Write this man down as childless,
A man who shall not prosper in his days;
For none of his descendants shall prosper,
Sitting on the throne of David,
And ruling anymore in Judah.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of My pasture!” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God of Israel against the shepherds who feed My people: “You have scattered My flock, driven them away, and not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for the evil of your doings,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I will gather the remnant of My flock out of all countries where I have driven them, and bring them back to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set up shepherds over them who will feed them; and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, nor shall they be lacking,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,
“That I will raise to David a Branch of righteousness;
A King shall reign and prosper,
And execute judgment and righteousness in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In His days Judah will be saved,
And Israel will dwell safely;
Now this is His name by which He will be called:
THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “that they shall no longer say, ‘As the Lord lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, ‘As the Lord lives who brought up and led the descendants of the house of Israel from the north country and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ And they shall dwell in their own land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart within me is broken
Because of the prophets;
All my bones shake.
I am like a drunken man,
And like a man whom wine has overcome,
Because of the Lord,
And because of His holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the land is full of adulterers;
For because of a curse the land mourns.
The pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up.
Their course of life is evil,
And their might is not right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For both prophet and priest are profane;
Yes, in My house I have found their wickedness,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria:
They prophesied by Baal
And caused My people Israel to err.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also I have seen a horrible thing in the prophets of Jerusalem:
They commit adultery and walk in lies;
They also strengthen the hands of evildoers,
So that no one turns back from his wickedness.
All of them are like Sodom to Me,
And her inhabitants like Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the prophets:
‘Behold, I will feed them with wormwood,
And make them drink the water of gall;
For from the prophets of Jerusalem
Profaneness has gone out into all the land.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
“Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you.
They make you worthless;
They speak a vision of their own heart,
Not from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They continually say to those who despise Me,
‘The Lord has said, “You shall have peace” ’;
And to everyone who walks according to the dictates of his own heart, they say,
‘No evil shall come upon you.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who has stood in the counsel of the Lord,
And has perceived and heard His word?
Who has marked His word and heard it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, a whirlwind of the Lord has gone forth in fury—
A violent whirlwind!
It will fall violently on the head of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The anger of the Lord will not turn back
Until He has executed and performed the thoughts of His heart.
In the latter days you will understand it perfectly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran.
I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they had stood in My counsel,
And had caused My people to hear My words,
Then they would have turned them from their evil way
And from the evil of their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Am I a God near at hand,” says the Lord,
“And not a God afar off?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy lies in My name, saying, ‘I have dreamed, I have dreamed!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will this be in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies? Indeed they are prophets of the deceit of their own heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who try to make My people forget My name by their dreams which everyone tells his neighbor, as their fathers forgot My name for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Is not My word like a fire?” says the Lord,
“And like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” says the Lord, “who steal My words every one from his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against the prophets,” says the Lord, “who use their tongues and say, ‘He says.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against those who prophesy false dreams,” says the Lord, “and tell them, and cause My people to err by their lies and by their recklessness. Yet I did not send them or command them; therefore they shall not profit this people at all,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So when these people or the prophet or the priest ask you, saying, ‘What is the oracle of the Lord?’ you shall then say to them, ‘What oracle?’ I will even forsake you,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And as for the prophet and the priest and the people who say, ‘The oracle of the Lord!’ I will even punish that man and his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus every one of you shall say to his neighbor, and every one to his brother, ‘What has the Lord answered?’ and, ‘What has the Lord spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the oracle of the Lord you shall mention no more. For every man’s word will be his oracle, for you have perverted the words of the living God, the Lord of hosts, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall say to the prophet, ‘What has the Lord answered you?’ and, ‘What has the Lord spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since you say, ‘The oracle of the Lord!’ therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Because you say this word, “The oracle of the Lord!” and I have sent to you, saying, “Do not say, ‘The oracle of the Lord!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you and forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, and will cast you out of My presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord showed me, and there were two baskets of figs set before the temple of the Lord, after Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah with the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs which could not be eaten, they were so bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?”
And I said, “Figs, the good figs, very good; and the bad, very bad, which cannot be eaten, they are so bad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘Like these good figs, so will I acknowledge those who are carried away captive from Judah, whom I have sent out of this place for their own good, into the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will set My eyes on them for good, and I will bring them back to this land; I will build them and not pull them down, and I will plant them and not pluck them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will give them a heart to know Me, that I am the Lord; and they shall be My people, and I will be their God, for they shall return to Me with their whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And as the bad figs which cannot be eaten, they are so bad’—surely thus says the Lord—‘so will I give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, his princes, the residue of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and those who dwell in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver them to trouble into all the kingdoms of the earth, for their harm, to be a reproach and a byword, a taunt and a curse, in all places where I shall drive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence among them, till they are consumed from the land that I gave to them and their fathers.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even to this day, this is the twenty-third year in which the word of the Lord has come to me; and I have spoken to you, rising early and speaking, but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord has sent to you all His servants the prophets, rising early and sending them, but you have not listened nor inclined your ear to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, ‘Repent now everyone of his evil way and his evil doings, and dwell in the land that the Lord has given to you and your fathers forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go after other gods to serve them and worship them, and do not provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands; and I will not harm you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not listened to Me,” says the Lord, “that you might provoke Me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts: ‘Because you have not heard My words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north,’ says the Lord, ‘and Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant, and will bring them against this land, against its inhabitants, and against these nations all around, and will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, a hissing, and perpetual desolations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this whole land shall be a desolation and an astonishment, and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then it will come to pass, when seventy years are completed, that I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans, for their iniquity,’ says the Lord; ‘and I will make it a perpetual desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will bring on that land all My words which I have pronounced against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied concerning all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For many nations and great kings shall be served by them also; and I will repay them according to their deeds and according to the works of their own hands.)’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord God of Israel to me: “Take this wine cup of fury from My hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send you, to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will drink and stagger and go mad because of the sword that I will send among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the cup from the Lord’s hand, and made all the nations drink, to whom the Lord had sent me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and its princes, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse, as it is this day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his princes, and all his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the mixed multitude, all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the land of the Philistines (namely, Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab, and the people of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the coastlands which are across the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who are in the farthest corners;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed multitude who dwell in the desert;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world which are on the face of the earth. Also the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Drink, be drunk, and vomit! Fall and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup from your hand to drink, then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “You shall certainly drink!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I begin to bring calamity on the city which is called by My name, and should you be utterly unpunished? You shall not be unpunished, for I will call for a sword on all the inhabitants of the earth,” says the Lord of hosts.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore prophesy against them all these words, and say to them:
‘The Lord will roar from on high,
And utter His voice from His holy habitation;
He will roar mightily against His fold.
He will give a shout, as those who tread the grapes,
Against all the inhabitants of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A noise will come to the ends of the earth—
For the Lord has a controversy with the nations;
He will plead His case with all flesh.
He will give those who are wicked to the sword,’ says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
“Behold, disaster shall go forth
From nation to nation,
And a great whirlwind shall be raised up
From the farthest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at that day the slain of the Lord shall be from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth. They shall not be lamented, or gathered, or buried; they shall become refuse on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wail, shepherds, and cry!
Roll about in the ashes,
You leaders of the flock!
For the days of your slaughter and your dispersions are fulfilled;
You shall fall like a precious vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the shepherds will have no way to flee,
Nor the leaders of the flock to escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice of the cry of the shepherds,
And a wailing of the leaders to the flock will be heard.
For the Lord has plundered their pasture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the peaceful dwellings are cut down
Because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has left His lair like the lion;
For their land is desolate
Because of the fierceness of the Oppressor,
And because of His fierce anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘Stand in the court of the Lord’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the Lord’s house, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Do not diminish a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps everyone will listen and turn from his evil way, that I may relent concerning the calamity which I purpose to bring on them because of the evil of their doings.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: “If you will not listen to Me, to walk in My law which I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to heed the words of My servants the prophets whom I sent to you, both rising up early and sending them (but you have not heeded),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the Lord had commanded him to speak to all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You will surely die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you prophesied in the name of the Lord, saying, ‘This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate, without an inhabitant’?” And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the house of the Lord and sat down in the entry of the New Gate of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and all the people, saying, “This man deserves to die! For he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and all the people, saying: “The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city with all the words that you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the Lord your God; then the Lord will relent concerning the doom that He has pronounced against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, here I am, in your hand; do with me as seems good and proper to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know for certain that if you put me to death, you will surely bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants; for truly the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the princes and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, “This man does not deserve to die. For he has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the elders of the land rose up and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts:
“Zion shall be plowed like a field,
Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins,
And the mountain of the temple
Like the bare hills of the forest.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah ever put him to death? Did he not fear the Lord and seek the Lord’s favor? And the Lord relented concerning the doom which He had pronounced against them. But we are doing great evil against ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was also a man who prophesied in the name of the Lord, Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjath Jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid and fled, and went to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiakim the king sent men to Egypt: Elnathan the son of Achbor, and other men who went with him to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought Urijah from Egypt and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord to me: ‘Make for yourselves bonds and yokes, and put them on your neck,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon, by the hand of the messengers who come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And command them to say to their masters, “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel—thus you shall say to your masters:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are on the ground, by My great power and by My outstretched arm, and have given it to whom it seemed proper to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant; and the beasts of the field I have also given him to serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all nations shall serve him and his son and his son’s son, until the time of his land comes; and then many nations and great kings shall make him serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, that the nation and kingdom which will not serve Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and which will not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation I will punish,’ says the Lord, ‘with the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your dreamers, your soothsayers, or your sorcerers, who speak to you, saying, “You shall not serve the king of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they prophesy a lie to you, to remove you far from your land; and I will drive you out, and you will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the nations that bring their necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will let them remain in their own land,’ says the Lord, ‘and they shall till it and dwell in it.’ ” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also spoke to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the Lord has spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy a lie to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not sent them,” says the Lord, “yet they prophesy a lie in My name, that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you and the prophets who prophesy to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Do not listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, “Behold, the vessels of the Lord’s house will now shortly be brought back from Babylon”; for they prophesy a lie to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to them; serve the king of Babylon, and live! Why should this city be laid waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they are prophets, and if the word of the Lord is with them, let them now make intercession to the Lord of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the Lord, in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, do not go to Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the pillars, concerning the Sea, concerning the carts, and concerning the remainder of the vessels that remain in this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yes, thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They shall be carried to Babylon, and there they shall be until the day that I visit them,’ says the Lord. ‘Then I will bring them up and restore them to this place.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened in the same year, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year and in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the house of the Lord in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus speaks the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two full years I will bring back to this place all the vessels of the Lord’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring back to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah who went to Babylon,’ says the Lord, ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah spoke to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and in the presence of all the people who stood in the house of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! The Lord do so; the Lord perform your words which you have prophesied, to bring back the vessels of the Lord’s house and all who were carried away captive, from Babylon to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless hear now this word that I speak in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets who have been before me and before you of old prophesied against many countries and great kingdoms—of war and disaster and pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet comes to pass, the prophet will be known as one whom the Lord has truly sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck and broke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Even so I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within the space of two full years.’ ” And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, after Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell Hananiah, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord: “You have broken the yokes of wood, but you have made in their place yokes of iron.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him. I have given him the beasts of the field also.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, “Hear now, Hananiah, the Lord has not sent you, but you make this people trust in a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will cast you from the face of the earth. This year you shall die, because you have taught rebellion against the Lord.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the remainder of the elders who were carried away captive—to the priests, the prophets, and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This happened after Jeconiah the king, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the smiths had departed from Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The letter was sent by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, to all who were carried away captive, whom I have caused to be carried away from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build houses and dwell in them; plant gardens and eat their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take wives and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons and give your daughters to husbands, so that they may bear sons and daughters—that you may be increased there, and not diminished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seek the peace of the city where I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray to the Lord for it; for in its peace you will have peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Do not let your prophets and your diviners who are in your midst deceive you, nor listen to your dreams which you cause to be dreamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they prophesy falsely to you in My name; I have not sent them, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: After seventy years are completed at Babylon, I will visit you and perform My good word toward you, and cause you to return to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, says the Lord, thoughts of peace and not of evil, to give you a future and a hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call upon Me and go and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will seek Me and find Me, when you search for Me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be found by you, says the Lord, and I will bring you back from your captivity; I will gather you from all the nations and from all the places where I have driven you, says the Lord, and I will bring you to the place from which I cause you to be carried away captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have said, “The Lord has raised up prophets for us in Babylon”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, concerning all the people who dwell in this city, and concerning your brethren who have not gone out with you into captivity—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord of hosts: Behold, I will send on them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like rotten figs that cannot be eaten, they are so bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pursue them with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence; and I will deliver them to trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth—to be a curse, an astonishment, a hissing, and a reproach among all the nations where I have driven them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have not heeded My words, says the Lord, which I sent to them by My servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; neither would you heed, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, all you of the captivity, whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in My name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall slay them before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because of them a curse shall be taken up by all the captivity of Judah who are in Babylon, saying, “The Lord make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have done disgraceful things in Israel, have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken lying words in My name, which I have not commanded them. Indeed I know, and am a witness, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also speak to Shemaiah the Nehelamite, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus speaks the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: You have sent letters in your name to all the people who are at Jerusalem, to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has made you priest instead of Jehoiada the priest, so that there should be officers in the house of the Lord over every man who is demented and considers himself a prophet, that you should put him in prison and in the stocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth who makes himself a prophet to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, ‘This captivity is long; build houses and dwell in them, and plant gardens and eat their fruit.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send to all those in captivity, saying, Thus says the Lord concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, and I have not sent him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord: Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his family: he shall not have anyone to dwell among this people, nor shall he see the good that I will do for My people, says the Lord, because he has taught rebellion against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus speaks the Lord God of Israel, saying: ‘Write in a book for yourself all the words that I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, the days are coming,’ says the Lord, ‘that I will bring back from captivity My people Israel and Judah,’ says the Lord. ‘And I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the words that the Lord spoke concerning Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For thus says the Lord:
‘We have heard a voice of trembling,
Of fear, and not of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ask now, and see,
Whether a man is ever in labor with child?
So why do I see every man with his hands on his loins
Like a woman in labor,
And all faces turned pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Alas! For that day is great,
So that none is like it;
And it is the time of Jacob’s trouble,
But he shall be saved out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘For it shall come to pass in that day,’
Says the Lord of hosts,
‘That I will break his yoke from your neck,
And will burst your bonds;
Foreigners shall no more enslave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they shall serve the Lord their God,
And David their king,
Whom I will raise up for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore do not fear, O My servant Jacob,’ says the Lord,
‘Nor be dismayed, O Israel;
For behold, I will save you from afar,
And your seed from the land of their captivity.
Jacob shall return, have rest and be quiet,
And no one shall make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am with you,’ says the Lord, ‘to save you;
Though I make a full end of all nations where I have scattered you,
Yet I will not make a complete end of you.
But I will correct you in justice,
And will not let you go altogether unpunished.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For thus says the Lord:
‘Your affliction is incurable,
Your wound is severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you cry about your affliction?
Your sorrow is incurable.
Because of the multitude of your iniquities,
Because your sins have increased,
I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I will restore health to you
And heal you of your wounds,’ says the Lord,
‘Because they called you an outcast saying:
“This is Zion;
No one seeks her.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord:
‘Behold, I will bring back the captivity of Jacob’s tents,
And have mercy on his dwelling places;
The city shall be built upon its own mound,
And the palace shall remain according to its own plan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘You shall be My people,
And I will be your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the whirlwind of the Lord
Goes forth with fury,
A continuing whirlwind;
It will fall violently on the head of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fierce anger of the Lord will not return until He has done it,
And until He has performed the intents of His heart. 
In the latter days you will consider it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the same time,” says the Lord, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be My people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“The people who survived the sword
Found grace in the wilderness—
Israel, when I went to give him rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Again I will build you, and you shall be rebuilt,
O virgin of Israel!
You shall again be adorned with your tambourines,
And shall go forth in the dances of those who rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall yet plant vines on the mountains of Samaria;
The planters shall plant and eat them as ordinary food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there shall be a day
When the watchmen will cry on Mount Ephraim,
‘Arise, and let us go up to Zion,
To the Lord our God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“Sing with gladness for Jacob,
And shout among the chief of the nations;
Proclaim, give praise, and say,
‘O Lord, save Your people,
The remnant of Israel!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will bring them from the north country,
And gather them from the ends of the earth,
Among them the blind and the lame,
The woman with child
And the one who labors with child, together;
A great throng shall return there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall come with weeping,
And with supplications I will lead them.
I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters,
In a straight way in which they shall not stumble;
For I am a Father to Israel,
And Ephraim is My firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear the word of the Lord, O nations,
And declare it in the isles afar off, and say,
‘He who scattered Israel will gather him,
And keep him as a shepherd does his flock.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has redeemed Jacob,
And ransomed him from the hand of one stronger than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they shall come and sing in the height of Zion,
Streaming to the goodness of the Lord—
For wheat and new wine and oil,
For the young of the flock and the herd;
Their souls shall be like a well-watered garden,
And they shall sorrow no more at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance,
And the young men and the old, together;
For I will turn their mourning to joy,
Will comfort them,
And make them rejoice rather than sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will satiate the soul of the priests with abundance,
And My people shall be satisfied with My goodness, says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
Lamentation and bitter weeping,
Rachel weeping for her children,
Refusing to be comforted for her children,
Because they are no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Refrain your voice from weeping,
And your eyes from tears;
For your work shall be rewarded, says the Lord,
And they shall come back from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is hope in your future, says the Lord,
That your children shall come back to their own border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself:
‘You have chastised me, and I was chastised,
Like an untrained bull;
Restore me, and I will return,
For You are the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Set up signposts,
Make landmarks;
Set your heart toward the highway,
The way in which you went.
Turn back, O virgin of Israel,
Turn back to these your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you gad about,
O you backsliding daughter?
For the Lord has created a new thing in the earth—
A woman shall encompass a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “They shall again use this speech in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I bring back their captivity: ‘The Lord bless you, O home of justice, and mountain of holiness!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall dwell in Judah itself, and in all its cities together, farmers and those going out with flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this I awoke and looked around, and my sleep was sweet to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and the seed of beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that as I have watched over them to pluck up, to break down, to throw down, to destroy, and to afflict, so I will watch over them to build and to plant, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days they shall say no more:
‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
And the children’s teeth are set on edge.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every one shall die for his own iniquity; every man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt, My covenant which they broke, though I was a husband to them, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I will put My law in their minds, and write it on their hearts; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No more shall every man teach his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’ for they all shall know Me, from the least of them to the greatest of them, says the Lord. For I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin I will remember no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
Who gives the sun for a light by day,
The ordinances of the moon and the stars for a light by night,
Who disturbs the sea,
And its waves roar
(The Lord of hosts is His name):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If those ordinances depart
From before Me, says the Lord,
Then the seed of Israel shall also cease
From being a nation before Me forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“If heaven above can be measured,
And the foundations of the earth searched out beneath,
I will also cast off all the seed of Israel
For all that they have done, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, that the city shall be built for the Lord from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The surveyor’s line shall again extend straight forward over the hill Gareb; then it shall turn toward Goath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields as far as the Brook Kidron, to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, shall be holy to the Lord. It shall not be plucked up or thrown down anymore forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then the king of Babylon’s army besieged Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the prison, which was in the king of Judah’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall take it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape from the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him face to face, and see him eye to eye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he shall lead Zedekiah to Babylon, and there he shall be until I visit him,” says the Lord; “though you fight with the Chaldeans, you shall not succeed” ’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeremiah said, “The word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you, saying, “Buy my field which is in Anathoth, for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hanamel my uncle’s son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the Lord, and said to me, ‘Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the country of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption yours; buy it for yourself.’ Then I knew that this was the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought the field from Hanamel, the son of my uncle who was in Anathoth, and weighed out to him the money—seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I signed the deed and sealed it, took witnesses, and weighed the money on the scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the purchase deed, both that which was sealed according to the law and custom, and that which was open;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I gave the purchase deed to Baruch the son of Neriah, son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses who signed the purchase deed, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I charged Baruch before them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Take these deeds, both this purchase deed which is sealed and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may last many days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when I had delivered the purchase deed to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to the Lord, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Ah, Lord God! Behold, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and outstretched arm. There is nothing too hard for You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show lovingkindness to thousands, and repay the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them—the Great, the Mighty God, whose name is the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are great in counsel and mighty in work, for Your eyes are open to all the ways of the sons of men, to give everyone according to his ways and according to the fruit of his doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, to this day, and in Israel and among other men; and You have made Yourself a name, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have given them this land, of which You swore to their fathers to give them—“a land flowing with milk and honey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came in and took possession of it, but they have not obeyed Your voice or walked in Your law. They have done nothing of all that You commanded them to do; therefore You have caused all this calamity to come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Look, the siege mounds! They have come to the city to take it; and the city has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans who fight against it, because of the sword and famine and pestilence. What You have spoken has happened; there You see it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And You have said to me, O Lord God, “Buy the field for money, and take witnesses”!—yet the city has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh. Is there anything too hard for Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Chaldeans who fight against this city shall come and set fire to this city and burn it, with the houses on whose roofs they have offered incense to Baal and poured out drink offerings to other gods, to provoke Me to anger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done only evil before Me from their youth. For the children of Israel have provoked Me only to anger with the work of their hands,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For this city has been to Me a provocation of My anger and My fury from the day that they built it, even to this day; so I will remove it from before My face
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke Me to anger—they, their kings, their princes, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have turned to Me the back, and not the face; though I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not listened to receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by My name, to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they built the high places of Baal which are in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire to Molech, which I did not command them, nor did it come into My mind that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore, thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning this city of which you say, ‘It shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will gather them out of all countries where I have driven them in My anger, in My fury, and in great wrath; I will bring them back to this place, and I will cause them to dwell safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be My people, and I will be their God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear Me forever, for the good of them and their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from doing them good; but I will put My fear in their hearts so that they will not depart from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will assuredly plant them in this land, with all My heart and with all My soul.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: ‘Just as I have brought all this great calamity on this people, so I will bring on them all the good that I have promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fields will be bought in this land of which you say, “It is desolate, without man or beast; it has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men will buy fields for money, sign deeds and seal them, and take witnesses, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South; for I will cause their captives to return,’ says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still shut up in the court of the prison, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord who made it, the Lord who formed it to establish it (the Lord is His name):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Call to Me, and I will answer you, and show you great and mighty things, which you do not know.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city and the houses of the kings of Judah, which have been pulled down to fortify against the siege mounds and the sword:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They come to fight with the Chaldeans, but only to fill their places with the dead bodies of men whom I will slay in My anger and My fury, all for whose wickedness I have hidden My face from this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will bring it health and healing; I will heal them and reveal to them the abundance of peace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will cause the captives of Judah and the captives of Israel to return, and will rebuild those places as at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they have sinned against Me, and I will pardon all their iniquities by which they have sinned and by which they have transgressed against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it shall be to Me a name of joy, a praise, and an honor before all nations of the earth, who shall hear all the good that I do to them; they shall fear and tremble for all the goodness and all the prosperity that I provide for it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘Again there shall be heard in this place—of which you say, “It is desolate, without man and without beast”—in the cities of Judah, in the streets of Jerusalem that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without beast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who will say:
“Praise the Lord of hosts,
For the Lord is good,
For His mercy endures forever”—
and of those who will bring the sacrifice of praise into the house of the Lord. For I will cause the captives of the land to return as at the first,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: ‘In this place which is desolate, without man and without beast, and in all its cities, there shall again be a dwelling place of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the lowland, in the cities of the South, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks shall again pass under the hands of him who counts them,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, the days are coming,’ says the Lord, ‘that I will perform that good thing which I have promised to the house of Israel and to the house of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In those days and at that time
I will cause to grow up to David
A Branch of righteousness;
He shall execute judgment and righteousness in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days Judah will be saved,
And Jerusalem will dwell safely.
And this is the name by which she will be called:
THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: ‘David shall never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall the priests, the Levites, lack a man to offer burnt offerings before Me, to kindle grain offerings, and to sacrifice continually.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘If you can break My covenant with the day and My covenant with the night, so that there will not be day and night in their season,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then My covenant may also be broken with David My servant, so that he shall not have a son to reign on his throne, and with the Levites, the priests, My ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, nor the sand of the sea measured, so will I multiply the descendants of David My servant and the Levites who minister to Me.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you not considered what these people have spoken, saying, ‘The two families which the Lord has chosen, He has also cast them off’? Thus they have despised My people, as if they should no more be a nation before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘If My covenant is not with day and night, and if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will cast away the descendants of Jacob and David My servant, so that I will not take any of his descendants to be rulers over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will cause their captives to return, and will have mercy on them.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army, all the kingdoms of the earth under his dominion, and all the people, fought against Jerusalem and all its cities, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not escape from his hand, but shall surely be taken and delivered into his hand; your eyes shall see the eyes of the king of Babylon, he shall speak with you face to face, and you shall go to Babylon.’ ” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet hear the word of the Lord, O Zedekiah king of Judah! Thus says the Lord concerning you: ‘You shall not die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall die in peace; as in the ceremonies of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they shall burn incense for you and lament for you, saying, “Alas, lord!” For I have pronounced the word, says the Lord.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the king of Babylon’s army fought against Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and Azekah; for only these fortified cities remained of the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem to proclaim liberty to them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that every man should set free his male and female slave—a Hebrew man or woman—that no one should keep a Jewish brother in bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the princes and all the people, who had entered into the covenant, heard that everyone should set free his male and female slaves, that no one should keep them in bondage anymore, they obeyed and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward they changed their minds and made the male and female slaves return, whom they had set free, and brought them into subjection as male and female slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: ‘I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the end of seven years let every man set free his Hebrew brother, who has been sold to him; and when he has served you six years, you shall let him go free from you.” But your fathers did not obey Me nor incline their ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you recently turned and did what was right in My sight—every man proclaiming liberty to his neighbor; and you made a covenant before Me in the house which is called by My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you turned around and profaned My name, and every one of you brought back his male and female slaves, whom you had set at liberty, at their pleasure, and brought them back into subjection, to be your male and female slaves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘You have not obeyed Me in proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother and every one to his neighbor. Behold, I proclaim liberty to you,’ says the Lord—‘to the sword, to pestilence, and to famine! And I will deliver you to trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth.
