verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give the men who have transgressed My covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before Me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between the parts of it—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the princes of Judah, the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their life. Their dead bodies shall be for meat for the birds of the heaven and the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes into the hand of their enemies, into the hand of those who seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army which has gone back from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will command,’ says the Lord, ‘and cause them to return to this city. They will fight against it and take it and burn it with fire; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without inhabitant.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to the house of the Rechabites, speak to them, and bring them into the house of the Lord, into one of the chambers, and give them wine to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, his brothers and all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I brought them into the house of the Lord, into the chamber of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, a man of God, which was by the chamber of the princes, above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the keeper of the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I set before the sons of the house of the Rechabites bowls full of wine, and cups; and I said to them, “Drink wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “We will drink no wine, for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, ‘You shall drink no wine, you nor your sons, forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not build a house, sow seed, plant a vineyard, nor have any of these; but all your days you shall dwell in tents, that you may live many days in the land where you are sojourners.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus we have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he charged us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, or our daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor to build ourselves houses to dwell in; nor do we have vineyard, field, or seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have dwelt in tents, and have obeyed and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it came to pass, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, that we said, ‘Come, let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans and for fear of the army of the Syrians.’ So we dwell at Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the word of the Lord to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Go and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, “Will you not receive instruction to obey My words?” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, which he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are performed; for to this day they drink none, and obey their father’s commandment. But although I have spoken to you, rising early and speaking, you did not obey Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have also sent to you all My servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, ‘Turn now everyone from his evil way, amend your doings, and do not go after other gods to serve them; then you will dwell in the land which I have given you and your fathers.’ But you have not inclined your ear, nor obeyed Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father, which he commanded them, but this people has not obeyed Me.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will bring on Judah and on all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the doom that I have pronounced against them; because I have spoken to them but they have not heard, and I have called to them but they have not answered.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites, “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Because you have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts and done according to all that he commanded you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not lack a man to stand before Me forever.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, that this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a scroll of a book and write on it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the adversities which I purpose to bring upon them, that everyone may turn from his evil way, that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote on a scroll of a book, at the instruction of Jeremiah, all the words of the Lord which He had spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am confined, I cannot go into the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go, therefore, and read from the scroll which you have written at my instruction, the words of the Lord, in the hearing of the people in the Lord’s house on the day of fasting. And you shall also read them in the hearing of all Judah who come from their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that they will present their supplication before the Lord, and everyone will turn from his evil way. For great is the anger and the fury that the Lord has pronounced against this people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading from the book the words of the Lord in the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before the Lord to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baruch read from the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the Lord, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court at the entry of the New Gate of the Lord’s house, in the hearing of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Michaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the Lord from the book,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he then went down to the king’s house, into the scribe’s chamber; and there all the princes were sitting—Elishama the scribe, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Michaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard when Baruch read the book in the hearing of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll from which you have read in the hearing of the people, and come.” So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand and came to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Sit down now, and read it in our hearing.” So Baruch read it in their hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened, when they had heard all the words, that they looked in fear from one to another, and said to Baruch, “We will surely tell the king of all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us now, how did you write all these words—at his instruction?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Baruch answered them, “He proclaimed with his mouth all these words to me, and I wrote them with ink in the book.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the princes said to Baruch, “Go and hide, you and Jeremiah; and let no one know where you are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went to the king, into the court; but they stored the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and told all the words in the hearing of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king sent Jehudi to bring the scroll, and he took it from Elishama the scribe’s chamber. And Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king and in the hearing of all the princes who stood beside the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month, with a fire burning on the hearth before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, when Jehudi had read three or four columns, that the king cut it with the scribe’s knife and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they were not afraid, nor did they tear their garments, the king nor any of his servants who heard all these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah implored the king not to burn the scroll; but he would not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to seize Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet, but the Lord hid them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the king had burned the scroll with the words which Baruch had written at the instruction of Jeremiah, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take yet another scroll, and write on it all the former words that were in the first scroll which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to Jehoiakim king of Judah, ‘Thus says the Lord: “You have burned this scroll, saying, ‘Why have you written in it that the king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and cause man and beast to cease from here?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: “He shall have no one to sit on the throne of David, and his dead body shall be cast out to the heat of the day and the frost of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish him, his family, and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring on them, on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah all the doom that I have pronounced against them; but they did not heed.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote on it at the instruction of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. And besides, there were added to them many similar words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But neither he nor his servants nor the people of the land gave heed to the words of the Lord which He spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “Pray now to the Lord our God for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jeremiah was coming and going among the people, for they had not yet put him in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh’s army came up from Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they departed from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, ‘Thus you shall say to the king of Judah, who sent you to Me to inquire of Me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army which has come up to help you will return to Egypt, to their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Chaldeans shall come back and fight against this city, and take it and burn it with fire.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: ‘Do not deceive yourselves, saying, “The Chaldeans will surely depart from us,” for they will not depart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though you had defeated the whole army of the Chaldeans who fight against you, and there remained only wounded men among them, they would rise up, every man in his tent, and burn the city with fire.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, when the army of the Chaldeans left the siege of Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Jeremiah went out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin to claim his property there among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was in the Gate of Benjamin, a captain of the guard was there whose name was Irijah the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he seized Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “You are defecting to the Chaldeans!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jeremiah said, “False! I am not defecting to the Chaldeans.” But he did not listen to him.
So Irijah seized Jeremiah and brought him to the princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the princes were angry with Jeremiah, and they struck him and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe. For they had made that the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeremiah entered the dungeon and the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then Zedekiah the king sent and took him out. The king asked him secretly in his house, and said, “Is there any word from the Lord?”
And Jeremiah said, “There is.” Then he said, “You shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, “What offense have I committed against you, against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where now are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or against this land’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore please hear now, O my lord the king. Please, let my petition be accepted before you, and do not make me return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah to the court of the prison, and that they should give him daily a piece of bread from the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was gone. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Shephatiah the son of Mattan, Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchiah heard the words that Jeremiah had spoken to all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘He who remains in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence; but he who goes over to the Chaldeans shall live; his life shall be as a prize to him, and he shall live.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: ‘This city shall surely be given into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army, which shall take it.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the princes said to the king, “Please, let this man be put to death, for thus he weakens the hands of the men of war who remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, by speaking such words to them. For this man does not seek the welfare of this people, but their harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the king said, “Look, he is in your hand. For the king can do nothing against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took Jeremiah and cast him into the dungeon of Malchiah the king’s son, which was in the court of the prison, and they let Jeremiah down with ropes. And in the dungeon there was no water, but mire. So Jeremiah sank in the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian, one of the eunuchs, who was in the king’s house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon. When the king was sitting at the Gate of Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ebed-Melech went out of the king’s house and spoke to the king, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon, and he is likely to die from hunger in the place where he is. For there is no more bread in the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king commanded Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian, saying, “Take from here thirty men with you, and lift Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon before he dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ebed-Melech took the men with him and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took from there old clothes and old rags, and let them down by ropes into the dungeon to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, “Please put these old clothes and rags under your armpits, under the ropes.” And Jeremiah did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they pulled Jeremiah up with ropes and lifted him out of the dungeon. And Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah the king sent and had Jeremiah the prophet brought to him at the third entrance of the house of the Lord. And the king said to Jeremiah, “I will ask you something. Hide nothing from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “If I declare it to you, will you not surely put me to death? And if I give you advice, you will not listen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Zedekiah the king swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying, “As the Lord lives, who made our very souls, I will not put you to death, nor will I give you into the hand of these men who seek your life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “Thus says the Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘If you surely surrender to the king of Babylon’s princes, then your soul shall live; this city shall not be burned with fire, and you and your house shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not surrender to the king of Babylon’s princes, then this city shall be given into the hand of the Chaldeans; they shall burn it with fire, and you shall not escape from their hand.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zedekiah the king said to Jeremiah, “I am afraid of the Jews who have defected to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they abuse me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jeremiah said, “They shall not deliver you. Please, obey the voice of the Lord which I speak to you. So it shall be well with you, and your soul shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you refuse to surrender, this is the word that the Lord has shown me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Now behold, all the women who are left in the king of Judah’s house shall be surrendered to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women shall say:
“Your close friends have set upon you
And prevailed against you;
Your feet have sunk in the mire,
And they have turned away again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘So they shall surrender all your wives and children to the Chaldeans. You shall not escape from their hand, but shall be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon. And you shall cause this city to be burned with fire.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “Let no one know of these words, and you shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the princes hear that I have talked with you, and they come to you and say to you, ‘Declare to us now what you have said to the king, and also what the king said to you; do not hide it from us, and we will not put you to death,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say to them, ‘I presented my request before the king, that he would not make me return to Jonathan’s house to die there.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the princes came to Jeremiah and asked him. And he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they stopped speaking with him, for the conversation had not been heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison until the day that Jerusalem was taken. And he was there when Jerusalem was taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem, and besieged it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the city was penetrated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the princes of the king of Babylon came in and sat in the Middle Gate: Nergal-Sharezer, Samgar-Nebo, Sarsechim, Rabsaris, Nergal-Sarezer, Rabmag, with the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was, when Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, that they fled and went out of the city by night, by way of the king’s garden, by the gate between the two walls. And he went out by way of the plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Chaldean army pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. And when they had captured him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, to Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced judgment on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes in Riblah; the king of Babylon also killed all the nobles of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, and bound him with bronze fetters to carry him off to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Chaldeans burned the king’s house and the houses of the people with fire, and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive to Babylon the remnant of the people who remained in the city and those who defected to him, with the rest of the people who remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left in the land of Judah the poor people, who had nothing, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take him and look after him, and do him no harm; but do to him just as he says to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent Nebushasban, Rabsaris, Nergal-Sharezer, Rabmag, and all the king of Babylon’s chief officers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they sent someone to take Jeremiah from the court of the prison, and committed him to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, that he should take him home. So he dwelt among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile the word of the Lord had come to Jeremiah while he was shut up in the court of the prison, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and speak to Ebed-Melech the Ethiopian, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will bring My words upon this city for adversity and not for good, and they shall be performed in that day before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will deliver you in that day,” says the Lord, “and you shall not be given into the hand of the men of whom you are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will surely deliver you, and you shall not fall by the sword; but your life shall be as a prize to you, because you have put your trust in Me,” says the Lord.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him bound in chains among all who were carried away captive from Jerusalem and Judah, who were carried away captive to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah and said to him: “The Lord your God has pronounced this doom on this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord has brought it, and has done just as He said. Because you people have sinned against the Lord, and not obeyed His voice, therefore this thing has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now look, I free you this day from the chains that were on your hand. If it seems good to you to come with me to Babylon, come, and I will look after you. But if it seems wrong for you to come with me to Babylon, remain here. See, all the land is before you; wherever it seems good and convenient for you to go, go there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Jeremiah had not yet gone back, Nebuzaradan said, “Go back to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people. Or go wherever it seems convenient for you to go.” So the captain of the guard gave him rations and a gift and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah went to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, to Mizpah, and dwelt with him among the people who were left in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the captains of the armies who were in the fields, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed to him men, women, children, and the poorest of the land who had not been carried away captive to Babylon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, took an oath before them and their men, saying, “Do not be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, I will indeed dwell at Mizpah and serve the Chaldeans who come to us. But you, gather wine and summer fruit and oil, put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that you have taken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, when all the Jews who were in Moab, among the Ammonites, in Edom, and who were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then all the Jews returned out of all places where they had been driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruit in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces that were in the fields came to Gedaliah at Mizpah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Do you certainly know that Baalis the king of the Ammonites has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to murder you?” But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke secretly to Gedaliah in Mizpah, saying, “Let me go, please, and I will kill Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no one will know it. Why should he murder you, so that all the Jews who are gathered to you would be scattered, and the remnant in Judah perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, “You shall not do this thing, for you speak falsely concerning Ishmael.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal family and of the officers of the king, came with ten men to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, at Mizpah. And there they ate bread together in Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and the ten men who were with him, arose and struck Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, with the sword, and killed him whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmael also struck down all the Jews who were with him, that is, with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there, the men of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened, on the second day after he had killed Gedaliah, when as yet no one knew it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that certain men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, eighty men with their beards shaved and their clothes torn, having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hand, to bring them to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went along; and it happened as he met them that he said to them, “Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah killed them and cast them into the midst of a pit, he and the men who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ten men were found among them who said to Ishmael, “Do not kill us, for we have treasures of wheat, barley, oil, and honey in the field.” So he desisted and did not kill them among their brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the pit into which Ishmael had cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had slain, because of Gedaliah, was the same one Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel. Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the rest of the people who were in Mizpah, the king’s daughters and all the people who remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam. And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive and departed to go over to the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces that were with him heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they took all the men and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah; and they found him by the great pool that is in Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was, when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, that they were glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people whom Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned around and came back, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men and went to the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, took from Mizpah all the rest of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah after he had murdered Gedaliah the son of Ahikam—the mighty men of war and the women and the children and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed and dwelt in the habitation of Chimham, which is near Bethlehem, as they went on their way to Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had murdered Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had made governor in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the captains of the forces, Johanan the son of Kareah, Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people, from the least to the greatest, came near
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, “Please, let our petition be acceptable to you, and pray for us to the Lord your God, for all this remnant (since we are left but a few of many, as you can see),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Lord your God may show us the way in which we should walk and the thing we should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them, “I have heard. Indeed, I will pray to the Lord your God according to your words, and it shall be, that whatever the Lord answers you, I will declare it to you. I will keep nothing back from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to Jeremiah, “Let the Lord be a true and faithful witness between us, if we do not do according to everything which the Lord your God sends us by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it is pleasing or displeasing, we will obey the voice of the Lord our God to whom we send you, that it may be well with us when we obey the voice of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened after ten days that the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, all the captains of the forces which were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your petition before Him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If you will still remain in this land, then I will build you and not pull you down, and I will plant you and not pluck you up. For I relent concerning the disaster that I have brought upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid; do not be afraid of him,’ says the Lord, ‘for I am with you, to save you and deliver you from his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will show you mercy, that he may have mercy on you and cause you to return to your own land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you say, ‘We will not dwell in this land,’ disobeying the voice of the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘No, but we will go to the land of Egypt where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor be hungry for bread, and there we will dwell’—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then hear now the word of the Lord, O remnant of Judah! Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘If you wholly set your faces to enter Egypt, and go to dwell there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be that the sword which you feared shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt; the famine of which you were afraid shall follow close after you there in Egypt; and there you shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall it be with all the men who set their faces to go to Egypt to dwell there. They shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence. And none of them shall remain or escape from the disaster that I will bring upon them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘As My anger and My fury have been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so will My fury be poured out on you when you enter Egypt. And you shall be an oath, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach; and you shall see this place no more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has said concerning you, O remnant of Judah, ‘Do not go to Egypt!’ Know certainly that I have admonished you this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were hypocrites in your hearts when you sent me to the Lord your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to the Lord our God, and according to all that the Lord your God says, so declare to us and we will do it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have this day declared it to you, but you have not obeyed the voice of the Lord your God, or anything which He has sent you by me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, know certainly that you shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence in the place where you desire to go to dwell.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened, when Jeremiah had stopped speaking to all the people all the words of the Lord their God, for which the Lord their God had sent him to them, all these words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men spoke, saying to Jeremiah, “You speak falsely! The Lord our God has not sent you to say, ‘Do not go to Egypt to dwell there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Baruch the son of Neriah has set you against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put us to death or carry us away captive to Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Johanan the son of Kareah, all the captains of the forces, and all the people would not obey the voice of the Lord, to remain in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces took all the remnant of Judah who had returned to dwell in the land of Judah, from all nations where they had been driven—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men, women, children, the king’s daughters, and every person whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, and Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch the son of Neriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to the land of Egypt, for they did not obey the voice of the Lord. And they went as far as Tahpanhes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take large stones in your hand, and hide them in the sight of the men of Judah, in the clay in the brick courtyard which is at the entrance to Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold, I will send and bring Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant, and will set his throne above these stones that I have hidden. And he will spread his royal pavilion over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he comes, he shall strike the land of Egypt and deliver to death those appointed for death, and to captivity those appointed for captivity, and to the sword those appointed for the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt, and he shall burn them and carry them away captive. And he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd puts on his garment, and he shall go out from there in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall also break the sacred pillars of Beth Shemesh that are in the land of Egypt; and the houses of the gods of the Egyptians he shall burn with fire.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews who dwell in the land of Egypt, who dwell at Migdol, at Tahpanhes, at Noph, and in the country of Pathros, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘You have seen all the calamity that I have brought on Jerusalem and on all the cities of Judah; and behold, this day they are a desolation, and no one dwells in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke Me to anger, in that they went to burn incense and to serve other gods whom they did not know, they nor you nor your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However I have sent to you all My servants the prophets, rising early and sending them, saying, “Oh, do not do this abominable thing that I hate!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not listen or incline their ear to turn from their wickedness, to burn no incense to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So My fury and My anger were poured out and kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is this day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore, thus says the Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Why do you commit this great evil against yourselves, to cut off from you man and woman, child and infant, out of Judah, leaving none to remain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in that you provoke Me to wrath with the works of your hands, burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have gone to dwell, that you may cut yourselves off and be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, the wickedness of the kings of Judah, the wickedness of their wives, your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have not been humbled, to this day, nor have they feared; they have not walked in My law or in My statutes that I set before you and your fathers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I will set My face against you for catastrophe and for cutting off all Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will take the remnant of Judah who have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to dwell there, and they shall all be consumed and fall in the land of Egypt. They shall be consumed by the sword and by famine. They shall die, from the least to the greatest, by the sword and by famine; and they shall be an oath, an astonishment, a curse and a reproach!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will punish those who dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that none of the remnant of Judah who have gone into the land of Egypt to dwell there shall escape or survive, lest they return to the land of Judah, to which they desire to return and dwell. For none shall return except those who escape.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the men who knew that their wives had burned incense to other gods, with all the women who stood by, a great multitude, and all the people who dwelt in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the word that you have spoken to us in the name of the Lord, we will not listen to you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will certainly do whatever has gone out of our own mouth, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty of food, were well-off, and saw no trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we stopped burning incense to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been consumed by the sword and by famine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women also said, “And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, did we make cakes for her, to worship her, and pour out drink offerings to her without our husbands’ permission?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the people—the men, the women, and all the people who had given him that answer—saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The incense that you burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, did not the Lord remember them, and did it not come into His mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord could no longer bear it, because of the evil of your doings and because of the abominations which you committed. Therefore your land is a desolation, an astonishment, a curse, and without an inhabitant, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have burned incense and because you have sinned against the Lord, and have not obeyed the voice of the Lord or walked in His law, in His statutes or in His testimonies, therefore this calamity has happened to you, as at this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jeremiah said to all the people and to all the women, “Hear the word of the Lord, all Judah who are in the land of Egypt!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: ‘You and your wives have spoken with your mouths and fulfilled with your hands, saying, “We will surely keep our vows that we have made, to burn incense to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her.” You will surely keep your vows and perform your vows!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, all Judah who dwell in the land of Egypt: ‘Behold, I have sworn by My great name,’ says the Lord, ‘that My name shall no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, “The Lord God lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will watch over them for adversity and not for good. And all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt shall be consumed by the sword and by famine, until there is an end to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a small number who escape the sword shall return from the land of Egypt to the land of Judah; and all the remnant of Judah, who have gone to the land of Egypt to dwell there, shall know whose words will stand, Mine or theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be a sign to you,’ says the Lord, ‘that I will punish you in this place, that you may know that My words will surely stand against you for adversity.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those who seek his life, as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, his enemy who sought his life.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the instruction of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, to you, O Baruch:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You said, “Woe is me now! For the Lord has added grief to my sorrow. I fainted in my sighing, and I find no rest.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Behold, what I have built I will break down, and what I have planted I will pluck up, that is, this whole land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do you seek great things for yourself? Do not seek them; for behold, I will bring adversity on all flesh,” says the Lord. “But I will give your life to you as a prize in all places, wherever you go.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against Egypt.
Concerning the army of Pharaoh Necho, king of Egypt, which was by the River Euphrates in Carchemish, and which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Order the buckler and shield,
And draw near to battle!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Harness the horses,
And mount up, you horsemen!
Stand forth with your helmets,
Polish the spears,
Put on the armor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have I seen them dismayed and turned back?
Their mighty ones are beaten down;
They have speedily fled,
And did not look back,
For fear was all around,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not let the swift flee away,
Nor the mighty man escape;
They will stumble and fall
Toward the north, by the River Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who is this coming up like a flood,
Whose waters move like the rivers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt rises up like a flood,
And its waters move like the rivers;
And he says, ‘I will go up and cover the earth,
I will destroy the city and its inhabitants.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come up, O horses, and rage, O chariots!
And let the mighty men come forth:
The Ethiopians and the Libyans who handle the shield,
And the Lydians who handle and bend the bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is the day of the Lord God of hosts,
A day of vengeance,
That He may avenge Himself on His adversaries.
The sword shall devour;
It shall be satiated and made drunk with their blood;
For the Lord God of hosts has a sacrifice
In the north country by the River Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The word that the Lord spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon would come and strike the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why are your valiant men swept away?
They did not stand
Because the Lord drove them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made many fall;
Yes, one fell upon another.
And they said, ‘Arise!
Let us go back to our own people
And to the land of our nativity
From the oppressing sword.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried there,
‘Pharaoh, king of Egypt, is but a noise.
He has passed by the appointed time!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As I live,” says the King,
Whose name is the Lord of hosts,
“Surely as Tabor is among the mountains
And as Carmel by the sea, so he shall come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you daughter dwelling in Egypt,
Prepare yourself to go into captivity!
For Noph shall be waste and desolate, without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Egypt is a very pretty heifer,
But destruction comes, it comes from the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also her mercenaries are in her midst like fat bulls,
For they also are turned back,
They have fled away together.
They did not stand,
For the day of their calamity had come upon them,
The time of their punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her noise shall go like a serpent,
For they shall march with an army
And come against her with axes,
Like those who chop wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They shall cut down her forest,” says the Lord,
“Though it cannot be searched,
Because they are innumerable,
And more numerous than grasshoppers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will bring punishment on Amon of No, and Pharaoh and Egypt, with their gods and their kings—Pharaoh and those who trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the hand of his servants. Afterward it shall be inhabited as in the days of old,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fear, O Jacob My servant,” says the Lord,
“For I am with you;
For I will make a complete end of all the nations
To which I have driven you,
But I will not make a complete end of you.
I will rightly correct you,
For I will not leave you wholly unpunished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Philistines, before Pharaoh attacked Gaza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Behold, waters rise out of the north,
And shall be an overflowing flood;
They shall overflow the land and all that is in it,
The city and those who dwell within;
Then the men shall cry,
And all the inhabitants of the land shall wail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the noise of the stamping hooves of his strong horses,
At the rushing of his chariots,
At the rumbling of his wheels,
The fathers will not look back for their children,
Lacking courage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the day that comes to plunder all the Philistines,
To cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper who remains;
For the Lord shall plunder the Philistines,
The remnant of the country of Caphtor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Baldness has come upon Gaza,
Ashkelon is cut off
With the remnant of their valley.
How long will you cut yourself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O you sword of the Lord,
How long until you are quiet?
Put yourself up into your scabbard,
Rest and be still!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can it be quiet,
Seeing the Lord has given it a charge
Against Ashkelon and against the seashore?
There He has appointed it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against Moab.
Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel:
“Woe to Nebo!
For it is plundered,
Kirjathaim is shamed and taken;
The high stronghold is shamed and dismayed—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No more praise of Moab.
In Heshbon they have devised evil against her:
‘Come, and let us cut her off as a nation.’
You also shall be cut down, O Madmen!
The sword shall pursue you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice of crying shall be from Horonaim:
‘Plundering and great destruction!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab is destroyed;
Her little ones have caused a cry to be heard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For in the Ascent of Luhith they ascend with continual weeping;
For in the descent of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee, save your lives!
And be like the juniper in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For because you have trusted in your works and your treasures,
You also shall be taken.
And Chemosh shall go forth into captivity,
His priests and his princes together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the plunderer shall come against every city;
No one shall escape.
The valley also shall perish,
And the plain shall be destroyed,
As the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give wings to Moab,
That she may flee and get away;
For her cities shall be desolate,
Without any to dwell in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed is he who does the work of the Lord deceitfully,
And cursed is he who keeps back his sword from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab has been at ease from his youth;
He has settled on his dregs,
And has not been emptied from vessel to vessel,
Nor has he gone into captivity.
Therefore his taste remained in him,
And his scent has not changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,
“That I shall send him wine-workers
Who will tip him over
And empty his vessels
And break the bottles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh,
As the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘We are mighty
And strong men for the war’?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The calamity of Moab is near at hand,
And his affliction comes quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bemoan him, all you who are around him;
And all you who know his name,
Say, ‘How the strong staff is broken,
The beautiful rod!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O daughter inhabiting Dibon,
Come down from your glory,
And sit in thirst;
For the plunderer of Moab has come against you,
He has destroyed your strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moab is shamed, for he is broken down.
Wail and cry!
Tell it in Arnon, that Moab is plundered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And judgment has come on the plain country:
On Holon and Jahzah and Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On Dibon and Nebo and Beth Diblathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On Kirjathaim and Beth Gamul and Beth Meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On Kerioth and Bozrah,
On all the cities of the land of Moab,
Far or near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horn of Moab is cut off,
And his arm is broken,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Make him drunk,
Because he exalted himself against the Lord.
Moab shall wallow in his vomit,
And he shall also be in derision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For was not Israel a derision to you?
Was he found among thieves?
For whenever you speak of him,
You shake your head in scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who dwell in Moab,
Leave the cities and dwell in the rock,
And be like the dove which makes her nest
In the sides of the cave’s mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We have heard the pride of Moab
(He is exceedingly proud),
Of his loftiness and arrogance and pride,
And of the haughtiness of his heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O vine of Sibmah! I will weep for you with the weeping of Jazer.
Your plants have gone over the sea,
They reach to the sea of Jazer.
The plunderer has fallen on your summer fruit and your vintage.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“From the cry of Heshbon to Elealeh and to Jahaz
They have uttered their voice,
From Zoar to Horonaim,
Like a three-year-old heifer;
For the waters of Nimrim also shall be desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moreover,” says the Lord,
“I will cause to cease in Moab
The one who offers sacrifices in the high places
And burns incense to his gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore My heart shall wail like flutes for Moab,
And like flutes My heart shall wail
For the men of Kir Heres.
Therefore the riches they have acquired have perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For every head shall be bald, and every beard clipped;
On all the hands shall be cuts, and on the loins sackcloth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A general lamentation
On all the housetops of Moab,
And in its streets;
For I have broken Moab like a vessel in which is no pleasure,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They shall wail:
‘How she is broken down!
How Moab has turned her back with shame!’
So Moab shall be a derision
And a dismay to all those about her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“Behold, one shall fly like an eagle,
And spread his wings over Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kerioth is taken,
And the strongholds are surprised;
The mighty men’s hearts in Moab on that day shall be
Like the heart of a woman in birth pangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Moab shall be destroyed as a people,
Because he exalted himself against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and the pit and the snare shall be upon you,
O inhabitant of Moab,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He who flees from the fear shall fall into the pit,
And he who gets out of the pit shall be caught in the snare.
For upon Moab, upon it I will bring
The year of their punishment,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Those who fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon
Because of exhaustion.
But a fire shall come out of Heshbon,
A flame from the midst of Sihon,
And shall devour the brow of Moab,
The crown of the head of the sons of tumult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, O Moab!
The people of Chemosh perish;
For your sons have been taken captive,
And your daughters captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet I will bring back the captives of Moab
In the latter days,” says the Lord.
Thus far is the judgment of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against the Ammonites.
Thus says the Lord:
“Has Israel no sons?
Has he no heir?
Why then does Milcom inherit Gad,
And his people dwell in its cities?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,
“That I will cause to be heard an alarm of war
In Rabbah of the Ammonites;
It shall be a desolate mound,
And her villages shall be burned with fire.
Then Israel shall take possession of his inheritance,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is plundered!
Cry, you daughters of Rabbah,
Gird yourselves with sackcloth!
Lament and run to and fro by the walls;
For Milcom shall go into captivity
With his priests and his princes together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast in the valleys,
Your flowing valley, O backsliding daughter?
Who trusted in her treasures, saying,
‘Who will come against me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will bring fear upon you,”
Says the Lord God of hosts,
“From all those who are around you;
You shall be driven out, everyone headlong,
And no one will gather those who wander off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But afterward I will bring back
The captives of the people of Ammon,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against Edom.
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
“Is wisdom no more in Teman?
Has counsel perished from the prudent?
Has their wisdom vanished?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee, turn back, dwell in the depths, O inhabitants of Dedan!
For I will bring the calamity of Esau upon him,
The time that I will punish him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If grape-gatherers came to you,
Would they not leave some gleaning grapes?
If thieves by night,
Would they not destroy until they have enough?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I have made Esau bare;
I have uncovered his secret places,
And he shall not be able to hide himself.
His descendants are plundered,
His brethren and his neighbors,
And he is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: “Behold, those whose judgment was not to drink of the cup have assuredly drunk. And are you the one who will altogether go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished, but you shall surely drink of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have sworn by Myself,” says the Lord, “that Bozrah shall become a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse. And all its cities shall be perpetual wastes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard a message from the Lord,
And an ambassador has been sent to the nations:
“Gather together, come against her,
And rise up to battle!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For indeed, I will make you small among nations,
Despised among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your fierceness has deceived you,
The pride of your heart,
O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock,
Who hold the height of the hill!
Though you make your nest as high as the eagle,
I will bring you down from there,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah
And their neighbors,” says the Lord,
“No one shall remain there,
Nor shall a son of man dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the floodplain of the Jordan
Against the dwelling place of the strong;
But I will suddenly make him run away from her.
And who is a chosen man that I may appoint over her?
For who is like Me?
Who will arraign Me?
And who is that shepherd
Who will withstand Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear the counsel of the Lord that He has taken against Edom,
And His purposes that He has proposed against the inhabitants of Teman:
Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out;
Surely He shall make their dwelling places desolate with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth shakes at the noise of their fall;
At the cry its noise is heard at the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, He shall come up and fly like the eagle,
And spread His wings over Bozrah;
The heart of the mighty men of Edom in that day shall be
Like the heart of a woman in birth pangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Damascus has grown feeble;
She turns to flee,
And fear has seized her.
Anguish and sorrows have taken her like a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is the city of praise not deserted, the city of My joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets,
And all the men of war shall be cut off in that day,” says the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus,
And it shall consume the palaces of Ben-Hadad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against Kedar and against the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon shall strike.
Thus says the Lord:
“Arise, go up to Kedar,
And devastate the men of the East!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their tents and their flocks they shall take away.
They shall take for themselves their curtains,
All their vessels and their camels;
And they shall cry out to them,
‘Fear is on every side!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee, get far away! Dwell in the depths,
O inhabitants of Hazor!” says the Lord.
“For Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you,
And has conceived a plan against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Arise, go up to the wealthy nation that dwells securely,” says the Lord,
“Which has neither gates nor bars,
Dwelling alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their camels shall be for booty,
And the multitude of their cattle for plunder.
I will scatter to all winds those in the farthest corners,
And I will bring their calamity from all its sides,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord of hosts:
‘Behold, I will break the bow of Elam,
The foremost of their might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against Elam I will bring the four winds
From the four quarters of heaven,
And scatter them toward all those winds;
There shall be no nations where the outcasts of Elam will not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies
And before those who seek their life.
I will bring disaster upon them,
My fierce anger,’ says the Lord;
‘And I will send the sword after them
Until I have consumed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set My throne in Elam,
And will destroy from there the king and the princes,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘But it shall come to pass in the latter days:
I will bring back the captives of Elam,’ says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that the Lord spoke against Babylon and against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare among the nations,
Proclaim, and set up a standard;
Proclaim—do not conceal it—
Say, ‘Babylon is taken, Bel is shamed.
Merodach is broken in pieces;
Her idols are humiliated,
Her images are broken in pieces.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For out of the north a nation comes up against her,
Which shall make her land desolate,
And no one shall dwell therein.
They shall move, they shall depart,
Both man and beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In those days and in that time,” says the Lord,
“The children of Israel shall come,
They and the children of Judah together;
With continual weeping they shall come,
And seek the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall ask the way to Zion,
With their faces toward it, saying,
‘Come and let us join ourselves to the Lord
In a perpetual covenant
That will not be forgotten.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
All who found them have devoured them;
And their adversaries said, ‘We have not offended,
Because they have sinned against the Lord, the habitation of justice,
The Lord, the hope of their fathers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And Chaldea shall become plunder;
All who plunder her shall be satisfied,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because you were glad, because you rejoiced,
You destroyers of My heritage,
Because you have grown fat like a heifer threshing grain,
And you bellow like bulls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your mother shall be deeply ashamed;
She who bore you shall be ashamed.
Behold, the least of the nations shall be a wilderness,
A dry land and a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the wrath of the Lord
She shall not be inhabited,
But she shall be wholly desolate.
Everyone who goes by Babylon shall be horrified
And hiss at all her plagues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Put yourselves in array against Babylon all around,
All you who bend the bow;
Shoot at her, spare no arrows,
For she has sinned against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout against her all around;
She has given her hand,
Her foundations have fallen,
Her walls are thrown down;
For it is the vengeance of the Lord.
Take vengeance on her.
As she has done, so do to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cut off the sower from Babylon,
And him who handles the sickle at harvest time.
For fear of the oppressing sword
Everyone shall turn to his own people,
And everyone shall flee to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel:
“Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land,
As I have punished the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up against the land of Merathaim, against it,
And against the inhabitants of Pekod.
Waste and utterly destroy them,” says the Lord,
“And do according to all that I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sound of battle is in the land,
And of great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the hammer of the whole earth has been cut apart and broken!
How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has opened His armory,
And has brought out the weapons of His indignation;
For this is the work of the Lord God of hosts
In the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Slay all her bulls,
Let them go down to the slaughter.
Woe to them!
For their day has come, the time of their punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of those who flee and escape from the land of Babylon
Declares in Zion the vengeance of the Lord our God,
The vengeance of His temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore her young men shall fall in the streets,
And all her men of war shall be cut off in that day,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you,
O most haughty one!” says the Lord God of hosts;
“For your day has come,
The time that I will punish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The most proud shall stumble and fall,
And no one will raise him up;
I will kindle a fire in his cities,
And it will devour all around him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their Redeemer is strong;
The Lord of hosts is His name.
He will thoroughly plead their case,
That He may give rest to the land,
And disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A sword is against the Chaldeans,” says the Lord,
“Against the inhabitants of Babylon,
And against her princes and her wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword is against the soothsayers, and they will be fools.
A sword is against her mighty men, and they will be dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword is against their horses,
Against their chariots,
And against all the mixed peoples who are in her midst;
And they will become like women.
A sword is against her treasures, and they will be robbed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A drought is against her waters, and they will be dried up.
For it is the land of carved images,
And they are insane with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore the wild desert beasts shall dwell there with the jackals,
And the ostriches shall dwell in it.
It shall be inhabited no more forever,
Nor shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah
And their neighbors,” says the Lord,
“So no one shall reside there,
Nor son of man dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, a people shall come from the north,
And a great nation and many kings
Shall be raised up from the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The king of Babylon has heard the report about them,
And his hands grow feeble;
Anguish has taken hold of him,
Pangs as of a woman in childbirth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the floodplain of the Jordan
Against the dwelling place of the strong;
But I will make them suddenly run away from her.
And who is a chosen man that I may appoint over her?
For who is like Me?
Who will arraign Me?
And who is that shepherd
Who will withstand Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear the counsel of the Lord that He has taken against Babylon,
And His purposes that He has proposed against the land of the Chaldeans:
Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out;
Surely He will make their dwelling place desolate with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the noise of the taking of Babylon
The earth trembles,
And the cry is heard among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Behold, I will raise up against Babylon,
Against those who dwell in Leb Kamai,
A destroying wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will send winnowers to Babylon,
Who shall winnow her and empty her land.
For in the day of doom
They shall be against her all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against her let the archer bend his bow,
And lift himself up against her in his armor.
Do not spare her young men;
Utterly destroy all her army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans,
And those thrust through in her streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Israel is not forsaken, nor Judah,
By his God, the Lord of hosts,
Though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee from the midst of Babylon,
And every one save his life!
Do not be cut off in her iniquity,
For this is the time of the Lord’s vengeance;
He shall recompense her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Babylon was a golden cup in the Lord’s hand,
That made all the earth drunk.
The nations drank her wine;
Therefore the nations are deranged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Babylon has suddenly fallen and been destroyed.
Wail for her!
Take balm for her pain;
Perhaps she may be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We would have healed Babylon,
But she is not healed.
Forsake her, and let us go everyone to his own country;
For her judgment reaches to heaven and is lifted up to the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has revealed our righteousness.
Come and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make the arrows bright!
Gather the shields!
The Lord has raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes.
For His plan is against Babylon to destroy it,
Because it is the vengeance of the Lord,
The vengeance for His temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set up the standard on the walls of Babylon;
Make the guard strong,
Set up the watchmen,
Prepare the ambushes.
For the Lord has both devised and done
What He spoke against the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you who dwell by many waters,
Abundant in treasures,
Your end has come,
The measure of your covetousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts has sworn by Himself:
“Surely I will fill you with men, as with locusts,
And they shall lift up a shout against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are futile, a work of errors;
In the time of their punishment they shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Portion of Jacob is not like them,
For He is the Maker of all things;
And Israel is the tribe of His inheritance.
The Lord of hosts is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
With you I will break in pieces the horse and its rider;
With you I will break in pieces the chariot and its rider;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And I will repay Babylon
And all the inhabitants of Chaldea
For all the evil they have done
In Zion in your sight,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, O destroying mountain,
Who destroys all the earth,” says the Lord.
“And I will stretch out My hand against you,
Roll you down from the rocks,
And make you a burnt mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall not take from you a stone for a corner
Nor a stone for a foundation,
